action->Bonded Vessel.name: Bonded Vessel
action->Bonded Vessel.description: The condition of a granite vulture's primary vessel dictates the vulture's maximum Hit Point value. Undamaged, the vulture-shaped vessel is an object with 28 Hit Points (BT 14). While the vulture is in spirit form, damaging them doesn't hurt the vessel, but damaging the vessel deals an equal amount of damage to the vulture. While the vulture Inhabits their vessel, they're a single target, and damage reduces the Hit Points of both the vulture and the vessel. If the vessel is broken, the vulture can still fight normally while inhabiting the vessel and suffers no ill effect; if the vessel is destroyed, the vulture is instantly incorporated into its secondary vessel.

action->Reconstitution.name: Reconstitution
action->Reconstitution.description: When the vulture reaches 0 Hit Points, their spirit dissipates. If their vessel remains intact, the vulture re-forms within it after [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2k4 days}, fully healed. If the vessel is broken, their receptacle reconstitutes the vessel in [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2k4 days}, and the vulture re-forms within it in another [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2k4 days}. In the meantime, the vulture's consciousness inhabits their spirit receptacle. If both their vessel and receptacle are destroyed, the vulture is instantly slain and can't reconstitute.

action->Spirit Receptacle.name: Spirit Receptacle
action->Spirit Receptacle.description: If the granite vulture's bonded vessel is destroyed, their spirit inhabits an inanimate skull-shaped receptacle. In this state, they're petrified and can take no actions other than to speak telepathically until they are Reconstituted. The spirit receptacle has 56 Hit Points (BT 14, Hardness 7).

action->Inhabit Vessel.name: Inhabit Vessel
action->Inhabit Vessel.description: The vulture touches and melds with their bonded vessel, bringing the statue to life. They can cease Inhabiting their Vessel by spending a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While Inhabiting the Vessel, they gain Immunities healing, nonlethal; Resistances physical 3 (except bludgeoning); and the following Strike.

action->Spirit Body.name: Spirit Body
action->Spirit Body.description: When not Inhabiting their vessel or receptacle, the vulture is incorporeal, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1}, and gains resistance 3 to all damage (except force damage and damage from Strikes with the ghost touch property rune; double resistance against non-magical).

Grave Hag.name: Grave Hag
Grave Hag.publicNotes:
Rot-skinned grave hags usually lair in cemeteries, mausoleums, and other burial sites; unlike most hags, they can't alter their appearance into a comely shape, so they hide from most observers. Grave hags consider such a predatory life hiding out in graveyards to be pitiful and squalid-they prefer to dwell in lands where necromancy is common and undeath isn't unusual. These grave hags become adept at necromantic magic and love posing as scholars. Schemers and plotters, they surround themselves with minions whom they send on missions to collect corpses for ghastly rituals.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
Grave Hag.saveDetails: statusowe +1 do wszystkich rzutów obronnych przeciw magii

action->Curse of the Grave.name: Curse of the Grave
action->Curse of the Grave.description:
The grave hag names a single creature within 30 feet; that creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or be afflicted with a grave curse equal to the hag's level. The curse lasts until the hag chooses to end it or is slain, rather than by returning items. Regardless of the save result, the target is then temporarily immune to the hag's grave curse for 24 hours.

Efekt You are hounded by undead creatures of the same level as the curse. Every night, you must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a failure, an incorporeal undead manifests to hassle and harry you throughout the night, retreating before it can take much damage and often preventing you from gaining a full night's rest. Whenever you enter a graveyard or other area where bodies are buried, you must succeed at the same flat check or a body animates as a corporeal undead (typically a skeleton or zombie) to attack you.

These undead are temporary and exist only to harry you; if you take control of the undead, move on, or otherwise avoid their attacks, incorporeal undead discorporate and corporeal undead collapse into ordinary corpses. The curse can be removed by returning the stolen items to their resting place.

action->Grave Impressions.name: Grave Impressions
action->Grave Impressions.description:

action->Undead Mien.name: Undead Mien
action->Undead Mien.description: A grave hag appears as an undead creature to magical effects.

Guloval.name: Guloval
Guloval.publicNotes:
Agathions are born from petitioners who achieved enlightenment in life or after death and received Nirvana's blessing. A guloval is small in stature but fierce, appearing as an anthropomorphic wolverine with gray and black fur, a white strip down the snout, and fearsome digging claws that can be easily used as weapons.

A guloval's core value is aggressive protection, and as such, they are one of the most militant of the normally peaceful agathions. A guloval attacks with a frightening ferocity to protect others, and they particularly seek out roles as guardians of children or the elderly. Despite this compulsion to protect those who may not be able to defend themselves, gulovals are also known for grumpy temperaments and impatience with social niceties. Most prefer to live as hermits when they're not assisting someone in need.
Guloval.saveDetails: +1 status bonus to all saves vs. magic

spell->Remove Disease.description: Healing magic purges disease from a creature's body. You attempt to counteract one disease afflicting the target.

action->Interposition.name: Interposition
action->Interposition.description:
Aktywator A ward within the guloval's reach would take damage from a Strike, and the guloval is within the attacker's reach

Efekt The guloval blocks the attack with their own body, taking the triggering attack's damage. The ward takes no damage.

action->Righteous Wound.name: Righteous Wound
action->Righteous Wound.description: When a guloval critically hits an evil creature with any melee Strike, the evil creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}. If that evil creature has damaged one of the guloval's wards within the last round, it's instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2}.

action->Shield Ward.name: Shield Ward
action->Shield Ward.description: The guloval enhances the magical link with their ward, granting that creature a +1 status bonus to its Armor Class and saving throws until the start of the guloval's next turn.

action->Wolverine's Protection.name: Wolverine's Protection
action->Wolverine's Protection.description: The guloval selects a single willing ally within 30 feet as their ward; that ally can't already be the ward of another guloval. Once an ally becomes a ward, a magical link forms between the guloval and the ward, and as long as they are on the same plane and both are alive, the guloval knows the ward's direction from them, distance from them, and any conditions affecting them. A guloval can maintain this link with up to 4 wards-if they select a fifth, one of the previous wards (chosen by the guloval) loses the link and is no longer a ward.

Hall of Mirrors.name: Hall of Mirrors
Hall of Mirrors.description: Among the many mirrored reflections lurk three trapped souls. By attacking reflections, these spirits cause wounds to appear on the bodies of those reflected in the mirror. If a trapped soul kills its victim, the soul escapes the mirror, replaced by its victim's soul.
Hall of Mirrors.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:24] (expert) to realign a mirror so a trapped soul can't hurt the reflections, @Check[religion|dc:28] (expert) to banish a trapped soul, or @Check[thievery|dc:28] (expert) to cover a mirror quickly enough to keep the trapped soul inside it; each successful attempt to disable the haunt reduces its number of actions by 1
Hall of Mirrors.routine: (3 actions) Each trapped soul makes a reflective rip Strike against the reflection of a creature in the room; each trapped soul must attack a different target.

action->Ghostly Images.name: Ghostly Images
action->Ghostly Images.description:
Aktywator Two or more creatures enter the room

Efekt Three trapped souls appear in mirrors throughout the room, menacing the reflections of the triggering creatures. The triggering creatures must each succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 3} on a critical failure). The haunt then rolls initiative.

action->Soul Shred.name: Soul Shred
action->Soul Shred.description: A creature damaged by the haunt's reflective ripple Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 1} until 1 minute after it leaves the room. This enfeebled condition is cumulative, up to enfeebled 4. If the creature dies from reflective rip, its soul is contained within the mirror until the mirror is broken and a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.HNEUSYnInffvGPHK]{Specter} emerges.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.3ld14dsn2RLu9owg]

Harmony's harp is a virtuoso instrument that weights 8 Bulk and is worth 500 gp for its artistic quality.

Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played. A virtuoso instrument gives a +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

action->Distracting Bitterness.name: Distracting Bitterness
action->Distracting Bitterness.description:
A character can attempt to incite Harmony's bitterness by mentioning how Hyrune treats her like a servant rather than a companion by attempting a @Check[deception|dc:32] or @Check[intimidation|dc:32] check.

Krytyczny Sukces Harmony shrieks in anger and abandons the fight at once, screaming "I'll teach him a lesson he won't soon forget!" as she Turns to Mist and leaves to seek out Hyrune.

Sukces Harmony shrieks in anger, then becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} as her fury distracts her on the following round.

Porażka The attempt fails, and Harmony is temporarily immune to further attempts to distract her in this way from that character for 24 hours

Krytyczna Porażka The attempt backfires, instead enraging Harmony. She is temporarily immune to further attempts to distract her in this way from anyone for 24 hours, and gains a +2 status bonus on Strikes made against the character who failed this check during this time.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.sAyR4uJbsWukZFZf]

Aktywator The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Efekt The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

action->Vampire Weaknesses.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5DuBTf37u88IrphJ]
Vampire Weaknesses
action->Vampire Weaknesses.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5DuBTf37u88IrphJ]

All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Uciekający} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1k6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

action->Create Spawn.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.wqptDG0IW6ExnISC]

If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|against:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

action->Dominate.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.AjTkksppymqzCivT]
Dominate
action->Dominate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.AjTkksppymqzCivT]

The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

action->Drink Blood.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.XHut4MN0JBgm7WaN]
Drink Blood
action->Drink Blood.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.XHut4MN0JBgm7WaN]

Wymagania A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Efekt The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[16[healing]]{16 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

action->Turn to Mist.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.Nnl5wg6smOzieTop]

condition->Slowed.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]

You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A hollow husk is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Memory Drain.name: Memory Drain
action->Memory Drain.description:
Wymagania The hollow husk has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}

Efekt Memories flow from the grabbed creature into the empty void that is the hollow husk's mind. The hollow husk deals the creature @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage, and the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Krytyczny Sukces Efekt nie wywiera wpływu na istotę.

Sukces The creature takes half damage.

Porażka The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} for 1 minute.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2} for 1 minute.

action->Part of the Attic.name: Part of the Attic
action->Part of the Attic.description: The hungering growth's hostile actions don't cause creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Zafascynowany} by the tempting aroma in the attic to recover from being fascinated.

@Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]

On a failed save, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 2} on a critical failure).

Hungry Cottage.name: Hungry Cottage
Hungry Cottage.description: Iron Taviah's cottage comes to life and tries to eat everyone in it. The hazard is divided into three areas: the basement becomes the cottage's stomach; the stairs act as the cottage's throat, becoming a steep, slippery incline that is greater difficult terrain; and the ground floor is the inside of the cottage's mouth. Creatures within the cottage can move around within it but can't exit without pulling the mouth open or slipping out while its teeth gnash. Characters who successfully escape the cottage are safe from the hazard.
Hungry Cottage.disable: The hungry cottage can't be damaged or disabled, but the danger in each area can be temporarily mitigated. In the stomach: @Check[athletics|dc:17|traits:action:climb] (trained) to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} atop the hoarded belongings and avoid contact with the acidic walls or floor for 1 round, or @Check[crafting|dc:25] (expert) as a 2-action activity to concoct an alchemical antacid that neutralizes acid damage dealt by the stomach for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1k4 rounds}. In the throat: @Check[athletics|dc:23] (trained) to hold the throat open for one round, allowing all characters in the stairs to use a Reflex save result one degree of success greater than their roll to avoid being pushed into the stomach, or @Check[nature|dc:23] or Survival as a 2-action activity to ease the throat's contractions and provide the same effect for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1k4 rounds}. In the mouth: @Check[athletics|dc:22|traits:action:force-open] to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} a window or a door and forcibly expel one creature that's within 10 feet of an exit from the cottage, or @Check[athletics|dc:25] (expert) as a 2-action activity to jam furniture in place that prevents the teeth from gnashing for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1k4 rounds} and allows anyone in the cottage to move from it during that time.
Hungry Cottage.reset: Once no creatures remain in the cottage, the hazard resets and returns to a normal cottage. The stairs and the basement are gone, however, as is Iron Taviah's body.
Hungry Cottage.routine: The cursed cottage uses 3 actions: Acidic Assault in the stomach, Swallowing Staircase in the throat, and Gnashing Portal in the mouth (in that order). Checks to disable the areas might prevent these actions for a brief time.

action->The Cottage Hungers.name: The Cottage Hungers
action->The Cottage Hungers.description:
Aktywator Iron Taviah is defeated in the cottage basement

Efekt The basement floor absorbs Iron Taviah, and the cottage transforms into a hungry, semi-animate creature. The cottage rolls initiative.

action->Acidic Assault.name: Acidic Assault
action->Acidic Assault.description: The walls and floor of the stomach steam with digestive juices; all creatures in contact with these surfaces take @Damage[(2d8+4)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic]).

action->Gnashing Portal.name: Gnashing Portal
action->Gnashing Portal.description:
Creatures on the cottage's main floor are ground down as massive teeth appear from the floor and ceiling, gnash, and recede into the architecture, dealing @Damage[(2d8+4)[bludgeoning]] damage. Creatures in this area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature takes no damage and, if within 10 feet of an exit on the ground floor, can choose to exit the cottage.

Sukces The creature takes half damage and, if within 10 feet of an exit on the ground floor, can attempt to escape the cottage as the teeth retract by attempting a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save. On a success, the creature exits the cottage; on a critical failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}.

Porażka The creature takes full damage and is knocked prone.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1}.

action->Swallowing Staircase.name: Swallowing Staircase
action->Swallowing Staircase.description: Muscular swallowing contractions force creatures down the stairs and into the stomach. Creatures on the stairs must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or be pushed 15 feet down the stairs (and across the basement floor with any excess forced movement if they're pushed to the bottom of the stairs). Creatures who critically fail this Reflex save fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony} at the end of this forced movement.

Hyrune can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

action->Divided Faith.name: Divided Faith
action->Divided Faith.description: Hyrune's devotion to Urgathoa has become undermined by his obsession with Orgesh. Urgathoa's religious symbol can be brandished at Hyrune to trigger his revulsion, provided the person attempting to do so accuses Hyrune of being a heretic or of betraying his faith. Hyrune takes a –2 circumstance penalty to Will saves to overcome this revulsion.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

action->Vampire Weaknesses.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5DuBTf37u88IrphJ]
Vampire Weaknesses
action->Vampire Weaknesses.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5DuBTf37u88IrphJ]

All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Uciekający} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1k6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

action->Change Shape.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ZMTnwyXjyfy7Ryi6]
Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ZMTnwyXjyfy7Ryi6]

The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Postać Zwierzęcia} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +28 attack modifier. These fangs deal 3k12+16 piercing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Create Spawn.name:

action->Create Spawn.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.wqptDG0IW6ExnISC]

If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|against:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.AjTkksppymqzCivT]

The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Drink Blood
action->Drink Blood.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.XHut4MN0JBgm7WaN]

Wymagania A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Efekt The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[22[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

He attempts a fangs Strike and deals an additional @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage on a successful hit and can attempt to Drink Blood if he as an action remaining, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus on his Athletics check to do so.

Intellect Assemblage.name: Intellect Assemblage
Intellect Assemblage.publicNotes: Intellect assemblages are artificial constructs created from the memories of others. These memories are solidified into jagged shards similar in appearance to shattered glass and fused together in vaguely humanoid-shaped clusters to create the assemblage's body. The resulting construct is incredibly intelligent but completely devoid of emotion, possessing the thoughts and memories of a multitude but no personal connection to any of them. Analytical and meticulous, intellect assemblages view the world and everything in it as parts of a complex equation or system. They place no value on life or morality and consider emotions an illogical weakness.

action->Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
action->Bardic Lore.description: Intellect assemblages are created from the thoughts and memories of hundreds of individuals, providing them a near limitless collection of data to pull from. action->Fascinating Facets.description: 20 feet. The thought shards composing the intellect assemblage's body reflect countless memories, thoughts, and dreams. A creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Zafascynowany} with the intellect assemblage for 1 round. An intellect assemblage can suppress or activate this aura as a single action with the concentrate trait.

action->Meticulous.name: Meticulous
action->Meticulous.description: An intellect assemblage is analytical. Whenever they fail a saving throw against a mental spell or effect, the intellect assemblage is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Slowed Duration]]{1k4 rounds} as they sift through the new information.

action->Invasive Thoughts.name: Invasive Thoughts
action->Invasive Thoughts.description: When the intellect assemblage gets a critical hit with a fist or memory shard Strike, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Zdezorientowany} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Confusion Duration]]{1k4 rounds}, as the memories stored in the assemblage's thought shards overwhelm the target's psyche.

action->Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
action->Bonds of Iron.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt Iron Taviah can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring from nothingness around a target at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Taviah gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Taviah doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature Escapes (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it; the cage has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

Kelganth.name: Kelganth
Kelganth.publicNotes:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.
Kelganth.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. vitality

An elegant, colorful gem cut into a complex geometric pattern is slotted into a narrow metal band that fits around your brow. You gain a +3 item bonus to checks to Recall Knowledge, regardless of the skill.

When you invest the diadem, you either increase your Intelligence score by 2 or increase it to 18, whichever would give you a higher score.

action->Font of Death.name: Font of Death
action->Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[11d12[void]] damage in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic]); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt Kemnebi regains 1 Focus Point. If he's stupefied, he reduces the value of his stupefied condition by one. If Kemnebi is affected by a mental effect or spell, Kemnebi attempts to counteract that effect or spell with a [[/r 1d20+33 #Counteract]]{+33} counteract modifier.

action->Deflect Attack.description:
Wymagania Kemnebi is aware of the attack, isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda}, and has a hand free

Aktywator Kemnebi is the target of a physical ranged attack or ranged spell attack

Efekt Kemnebi gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, Kemnebi has deflected it. He can't use this reaction to deflect unusually massive ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

action->Drain Thoughts.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.wEL7ZDMaSWSSYQG9]

Wymagania A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny}, or willing creature is within Kemnebi's reach

Efekt Kemnebi seizes a creature and consumes its memories. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2} and Kemnebi regains @Damage[35[healing]]{35 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Draining Thoughts from a creature that's already stupefied doesn't restore any HP to Kemnebi but increases the victim's stupefied value by 2. Additionally, Kemnebi views one of the victim's memories and can choose to alter, enhance, or erase the memory he views as 4.- level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory}.

A victim's stupefied condition value decreases by 1 every week.

A victim who becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 5} in this way is rendered comatose, becoming permanently unconscious. As long as Kemnebi lives, a comatose victim can't regain consciousness, and its stupefied condition doesn't decrease.

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Grad Ciosów
action->Flurry of Blows.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt Kemnebi makes two claw Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. Kemnebi applies his multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

action->Paralyzing Claws.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.yfNDFjz7VBvvLwee]

action->Paralyzing Claws.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.yfNDFjz7VBvvLwee]

Any living, non-mindless creature hit by Kemnebi's claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

action->Controlled.name: Controlled
action->Controlled.description: Kemnebi can manipulate one of his comatose victims as if they were a puppet, maintaining complete control over each. Kemnebi's puppets are immune to all mental effects. Kemnebi can stop controlling one of his puppets as a free action. If he does, the puppet returns to its comatose state, becoming permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny}. Kemnebi can reassert control as a free action, causing the puppet to temporarily lose the unconscious condition.

action->Gang Up.name: Osaczenie
action->Gang Up.description: Kemnebi's puppets work together to take down more powerful foes. A puppet's Strikes deal an additional 4k6 damage against a creature that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} by at least one of the puppet's allies.

action->Called.name: Called
action->Called.description: In constantly resisting her desire to return to her mother, Kepgeda has developed a mental bulwark. If she rolls a success on a saving throw against a mental effect that would make her controlled, she gets a critical success instead.

action->Cackling Coven.name: Cackling Coven
action->Cackling Coven.description:
Aktywator Kepgeda's turn begins

Wymagania Kepgeda is within 30 feet of her keening cauldron

Efekt Kepgeda draws on the souls of her dead sisters for a burst of occult power, for a price. Kepgeda takes @Damage[10[mental]] damage, then chooses one:

  • Kepgeda Sustains a Spell. If her next action is to cast a witch hex, the DC of that hex increases by 1.
  • Kepgeda reduces her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony} condition value to 0.
  • If Kepgeda begins casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.c3b6LdLlQDPngNIb]{Create Undead} ritual within the next minute, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:18] when the ritual is complete; on a success, the undead she's created is 3 levels higher than the ritual would provide (for example, creating a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.WioQ6rOeMRuTOliY]{Zombie Brute} instead of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.Xo4IGzw28hivgMmM]{Zombie Shambler}).

action->Familiar.name: Chowaniec
action->Familiar.description: Kepgeda's familiar is Iskessous, a rat with a climb Speed of 25 feet, darkvision, and scent as an imprecise sense to a range of 30 feet.

Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.name: Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.description: The cauldron's ear-splitting keening calls forth spectral claws to assail ears and souls alike.
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:22] to tip the cauldron, or @Check[occultism|dc:20] or @Check[religion|dc:20] (trained) to ward against the cauldron's effects. Any combination of three successful attempts is required to fully disable the haunt. When the haunt is disabled, the coven seeks vengeance.
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.reset: The haunt becomes inert (resuming its usual screaming) at the end of any round in which no creatures other than Kepgeda remain in her kitchen.
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.routine: (1 action) The spectral hands scurry about, grabbing at all of Kepgeda's foes in area E13. Each such creature takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:20|basic]) as the spectral claws assail them. A creature that takes mental damage from this effect doesn't reduce their frightened value at the end of their next turn.

action->Crescendo of Claws.name: Crescendo of Claws
action->Crescendo of Claws.description:
Aktywator A creature other than Kepgeda is within 15 feet of the cauldron for at least 1 round

Efekt The screams increase in intensity, and a torrent of phantasmal, three-fingered hands with iron claws spews from the cauldron to assail creatures in area E13. Each creature in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save, with the following results. Kepgeda is immune to the haunt's effects, as she loves the cauldron's screams. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}.

Porażka The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2} and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} as long as they remain frightened.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} as long as they remain frightened.

A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach.

On a success, you deal 2k4 fire damage. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and @Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,fire]] damage.

action->Biting Snakes.name: Biting Snakes
action->Biting Snakes.description:
Aktywator A creature ends its turn adjacent to Kerinza

Efekt Kerinza makes a snake fangs Strike against the creature.

action->Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
action->Petrifying Gaze.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save. If the creature fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for 1 minute. Kerinza can activate or deactivate this aura by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait, but deactivating it is painful for her; she gains weakness 15 to physical damage while her petrifying gaze is deactivated.

action->Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
action->Focus Gaze.description: Kerinza fixes her glare on a creature she can see within 30 feet. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save against Kerinza's petrifying gaze. If the target was already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony} before attempting its save, a failed save causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Spetryfikowany} permanently. After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of Kerinza's next turn.

action->Quick Responses.name: Quick Responses
action->Quick Responses.description: If Kerinza isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony}, her Strikes deal an additional 2k6 precision damage to slowed targets.

action->Serpent Venom.name: Serpent Venom
action->Serpent Venom.description:
Rzut Obronny @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maksymalny Czas Trwania 6 rund

Stadium 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 1} (1 runda)

Stadium 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 2} (1 runda)

Stadium 3 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 3} (1 runda)

Keystone Repulsion.name: Keystone Repulsion
Keystone Repulsion.description: Four magic keystones repel creatures when one is damaged or tampered with.
Keystone Repulsion.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to remove each keystone or @Check[occultism|dc:48] (legendary) to manipulate the magic to isolate each keystone
Keystone Repulsion.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each removed or isolated keystone. Each keystone spends 1 action to release a wave of force, dealing @Damage[(4d10+22)[force]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic]) and pushing each creature back 5 feet. On a failed save, the distance a creature is pushed increases to 10 feet.

action->Repel.name: Repel
action->Repel.description:
Aktywator A creature damages or tampers with a keystone

Efekt The triggering creature is moved back 10 feet by a wave of force. A successful @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save reduces the distance moved to 5 feet. The trap then rolls initiative.

Keystone Trap.name: Keystone Trap
Keystone Trap.description: A 5-foot-square metal vault covered with knobs lies concealed within a stone block. A lever on the stone block slides the vault into view. When the vault is exposed-whether it's slid out or whether the stone is smashed open-the trap activates.
Keystone Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to find and press hidden knobs in a specific order (three successes are required to disable the trap, which also opens it); @Check[crafting|dc:24] (expert) to sabotage the vault's mechanisms, reducing its actions by 1 (when the trap's actions are reduced to 0, it is disabled)
Keystone Trap.routine: The keystone uses its 3 actions to Electrify, Spin, and then Launch Darts. When the trap loses an action, roll randomly to determine which action it loses.

action->Exposed Vault.name: Exposed Vault
action->Exposed Vault.description:
Aktywator The vault is exposed

Efekt The vault makes a poison dart spray Strike at a random creature within 30 feet. The trap then rolls initiative.

action->Electrify.name: Electrify
action->Electrify.description: The metal vault crackles with electricity. In air, this would damage only creatures touching it; in water, the trap deals @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]).

action->Launch Darts.name: Launch Darts
action->Launch Darts.description: The vault fires a stream of poisoned darts. The trap attacks all creatures in a @Template[line|distance:30] with its poison dart spray Strike; roll [[/r 1d8]] to determine the line's direction. These Strikes don't have a multiple attack penalty.

action->Spin.name: Spin
action->Spin.description: The vault spins quickly for 1 round. While it Spins, checks to disable the trap have a –2 circumstance penalty, and it Launches Darts at all creatures within 30 feet of it, rather than in a line.

Aktywator Lasheeli or an ally within 30 feet attempts a Will save

Efekt Lasheeli orates a line or two from one of her stories and makes a Performance check. Lasheeli and any allies can use the better result of her check or their saving throw.

action->Divine Aegis.name: Divine Aegis
action->Divine Aegis.description: Once per day when Lasheeli takes damage that would reduce her to 0 Hit Points, a radiant, holy shield flashes over her, negating all of the attack's spirit damage and half of any other damage the attack deals. If the attacker is within 60 feet, divine aegis deals the attacker the same amount of damage it prevented (of the same type, except that if divine aegis prevents spirit damage, it deals the attacker spirit damage instead).

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Niezachwiane Czarowanie
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Lasheeli's spellcasting, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]; on a success, the spell isn't disrupted.

action->Shard Shield.name: Shard Shield
action->Shard Shield.description:
Aktywator A creature targets Matron Uldrula with an attack

Wymagania Matron Uldrula has been reduced to 150 Hit Points or fewer

Efekt The fragments of Matron Uldrula, sheared off from her form during this encounter, fly through the air, interposing themselves between Matron Uldrula and harm. Matron Uldrula gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Soul Shards.name: Soul Shards
action->Soul Shards.description: When Matron Uldrula is wounded, tiny fragments of her break away, littering the floor with glass-like shards. In their place, glimmering gold cracks crisscross Matron Uldrula's form, each hard as steel. When Matron Uldrula is reduced to 150 Hit Points or fewer, she gains resistance 10 to all physical damage, as her body becomes more gold than flesh.

action->Infuse Staff.name: Infuse Staff
action->Infuse Staff.description: Matron Uldrula's staff is her symbol of office and gains a measure of her personal power. This staff becomes a +2 greater striking staff and is treated as if it were adamantine while Matron Uldrula wields it. Matron Uldrula's staff has Hardness 17 and HP 68 (BT 34) while possessed by her, or Hardness 5 and HP 20 (BT 10) while out of her possession. If her staff is taken or destroyed, Matron Uldrula can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

action->Soul Lock.name: Soul Lock
action->Soul Lock.description:
Wymagania Matron Uldrula doesn't have a soul locked within her staff

Efekt Matron Uldrula attempts to capture the soul of a creature on the brink of death, either an undead creature or a creature with the dying condition. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:46] save with the following results.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock.

Sukces Matron Uldrula's staff tugs at the creature's soul but doesn't trap it. If the creature is living, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (or increases its doomed condition by 1). If the creature is a corporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 2}. If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to soul lock for 24 hours.

Porażka Matron Uldrula locks the creature's soul in her staff. If the creature is living, it dies. If the creature is a corporeal undead, its body becomes an inanimate corpse. If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes bodily trapped within the staff. While the soul is locked in the staff, the target can't be returned to life or undeath, or rejuvenated through any means, save powerful magic, such as miracle or wish, or through divine intervention. If Matron Uldrula's staff is destroyed or she wills it, the soul is released. Matron Uldrula's staff can only hold one soul at a time.

action->Spirit Touch.name: Widmowy Dotyk
action->Spirit Touch.description: Matron Uldrula's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Duchowego Dotyku} property rune and deal @Damage[4d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[4d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2k6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. Mechanical Laborer.name: Mechanical Laborer
Mechanical Laborer.publicNotes:
Animated statues are often used to guard crypts, small shrines, or areas in government buildings where they can be positioned amid normal statues to hide their true nature until an intruder arouses their ire. Adventurers' suspicions regarding statues suddenly animating and attacking has led many less scrupulous adventurers to automatically attack any statues they encounter, ruining harmless, ancient relics.

Ożywione przedmioty, obdarzone namiastką życia w wyniku zastosowania rytuałów lub innej osobliwej magii, wystąpują w wielu postaciach i mają różnorakie zastosowania. Wiele z tych istot pełni rolę strażników, zaskakujących nieświadomych poszukiwaczy przygód nagłym atakiem. Inne stanowią dla wyjątkowo bogatych źródło rozrywki, prostą służbę stworzoną do wykonywania prymitywnych zadań i tym podobne.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 8).name: Pancerz Konstruktu (Twardość 8)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 8).description: Like normal objects, a mechanical laborer has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by 8. Once a mechanical laborer is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks. It loses its Hardness, and its Armor Class is reduced to 18.

Memory Hole.description: Anyone looking into the hole has memories sucked from their head.
Memory Hole.disable: @Check[deception|dc:29] (master) to feed the pit false thoughts that plug it, or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (expert) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (4. level; counteract DC 27) to drain the pit's magic

action->Shatter Mind.description:

Mithral Golem.name: Mithral Golem
Mithral Golem.publicNotes:
Mithral golems are gorgeously crafted, silvery humanoids made from colossal amounts of the purest dawnsilver. While massive in construction, they possess amazing speed and grace through literal fluidity. Unpredictable and flexible, they can melt into liquid form and reform into a solid shape in mere seconds, allowing them to shape their limbs into sharp spikes or heavy fists as needed.

Powerful constructs that blend magic and raw material, golems make ideal guardians and bodyguards, with forms and functions as varied as the needs of those who employ them. As their crafters experiment with more exotic components and create new formulas, golems with surprising abilities emerge.

condition->Quickened.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]

You gain 1 additional action at the start of your turn each round. Many effects that make you quickened specify the types of actions you can use with this additional action. If you become quickened from multiple sources, you can use the extra action you've been granted for any single action allowed by any of the effects that made you quickened. Because quickened has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately gain actions if you become quickened during your turn.

action->Evasion.name: Evasion
action->Evasion.description: When the mithral golem rolls a success on a Reflex save, it gets a critical success instead.

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for [[/gmr 2d6 #rounds]]{2k6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

action->Swift Steps.name: Swift Steps
action->Swift Steps.description: A mithral golem is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Przyspieszony}, and it can use the extra action only to Step or Stride.

action->Vulnerable to Slow.name: Vulnerable to Slow
action->Vulnerable to Slow.description: A mithral golem is not healed by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Spowolnienie} spell, and such spells affect them normally. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Przyspieszenie} spell reverses the effects of a slow spell immediately.

action->Liquefy.name: Liquefy
action->Liquefy.description: The mithral golem becomes fully liquid and amorphous. It gains immunity to precision damage, but it takes double damage from cold and water magic (see golem antimagic). The only actions it can use while Liquefied are move actions, Spike Storm, and spike Strikes. It can resume its normal form by taking this action again.

action->Spike Storm.name: Spike Storm
action->Spike Storm.description: The mithral golem makes a spike Strike against each target within its reach. These attacks count toward the mithral golem's multiple attack penalty, but its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

condition->Slowed.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]

You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Trundling Gore.name: Trundling Gore
action->Trundling Gore.description: Mosghuta surges forward at her foe, horn lowered. She Strides once. If she ends her movement within melee range of an enemy, she makes a horn Strike against that enemy. If that Strike succeeds, Mosghuta uses Knockdown as a free action.

Mummy Valet.name: Mummy Valet
Mummy Valet.publicNotes:
The majority of mummies were created by cruel and selfish masters to serve as guardians to protect their tombs from intruders. The traditional method of creating a mummy guardian is a laborious and sadistic process that begins well before the poor soul to be transformed is dead, during which the victim is ritualistically starved of nourishing food and instead fed strange spices, preservative agents, and toxins intended to quicken the desiccation of the flesh. The victim remains immobile but painfully aware during the final stages, where its now-useless entrails are extracted before it's shrouded in funerary wrappings and entombed within a necromantically ensorcelled sarcophagus to await intrusions in the potentially distant future. While it's certainly possible to use other methods to create a mummy guardian from an already-deceased body, those who seek to create these foul undead as their guardians in the afterlife often feel that such methods result in inferior undead-the pain and agony of death by mummification being an essential step in the process.

Regardless of the method of their creation, mummy guardians are more than just physical shells of flesh and bone-they retain fragmented, distorted versions of their minds, with only enough memories of their living personality remaining to fuel their undead anger and jealousy of those who yet live. This burning rage only intensifies over the centuries of waiting within a crypt for the chance to actually act, and thus when most mummy guardians are awoken by tomb robbers or adventurers, they stop at nothing in pursuit of glorious slaughter.

While many cultures practice mummification of the dead for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through foul rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians.

action->Subtle Presence.name: Subtle Presence
action->Subtle Presence.description: The mummy valet activates or deactivates its despair aura.

action->Despair.name: Despair
action->Despair.description:
30 feet. Living creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1} while in a mummy guardian's despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave the area. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany} for 1 round. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1bOSJ2LbEC28aI9f]{Efekt: Despair}

Necrohulk Flailer.name: Necrohulk Flailer
Necrohulk Flailer.publicNotes:
Additional limbs, failing tentacles, and rubbery bodies are common among Mana Wastes mutants, and aspiring necrohulk creators like to combine flesh from more than one of these kinds of mutants to create gangly but powerful warriors.

The strange, terrible energies swirling about on the winds and embedded in the earth of the Mana Wastes have led to unexpected changes and mutations in the bodies of those who dwell there. These mutants usually have little chance to escape their hardscrabble existence, as they're ostracized by other societies. People in the kingdom of Nex to the north look on such folk with suspicion, as do the dwarves of Alkenstar to the west. Surprisingly, the undead nation of Geb to the south is often the best hope for a future among people with unusual appearances.

Those who flee to Geb or are convinced to make it their home frequently find their welcome to be a false promise, however. Necromancers who long ago tired of animating the same humanoids find new potential in mutated flesh, and mutants who aren't careful might find themselves led into laboratories or crypts for experimentation.

Enterprising twilight sages of Yled's Mortuarium have innovated bizarre combinations of alchemy and necromancy that boost their victims' mutations to persist even after reanimation. Although these necrohulks are virtually mindless and require a constant influx of chemicals to retain their might, they're more than powerful enough to make the extremely difficult process worth the effort. The cartridge containing the alchemical formulation that sustains them is perhaps the trickiest part of necrohulk animation, and it's easiest to simply stitch the cartridge right into the necrohulk's flesh.

Yled's armies contain a growing number of necrohulks. This isn't solely because these juggernauts are frightening effective combatants on the field of battle; leveraging the instinctive revulsion that mutants create carries some strategic advantage. Although the occasional necrohulks do run amok in Yled, addled on the chemical cocktails that sustain them, military necromancers generally keep them under control.

action->Alchemical Cartridge.name: Alchemical Cartridge
action->Alchemical Cartridge.description: Critical hits rupture the necrohulk's alchemical cartridge. The first time the necrohulk takes a critical hit, it loses its regeneration. The second time it takes a critical hit, it takes @Damage[15[persistent,acid]]{15} damage that it can't heal unless the cartridge is stitched back into place.

action->Regeneration 15 (Deactivated by.name:

action->Tentacle Storm.name: Tentacle Storm
action->Tentacle Storm.description: The necrohulk flailer makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the necrohulk makes all of these attacks.

Necrohulk Smasher.name: Necrohulk Smasher
Necrohulk Smasher.publicNotes:
Mutants with incredible strength make the most powerful necrohulks. These necrohulk smashers are so swollen with biological and alchemical muscle enhancements that they can simply pound their way through enemies.

The strange, terrible energies swirling about on the winds and embedded in the earth of the Mana Wastes have led to unexpected changes and mutations in the bodies of those who dwell there. These mutants usually have little chance to escape their hardscrabble existence, as they're ostracized by other societies. People in the kingdom of Nex to the north look on such folk with suspicion, as do the dwarves of Alkenstar to the west. Surprisingly, the undead nation of Geb to the south is often the best hope for a future among people with unusual appearances.

Those who flee to Geb or are convinced to make it their home frequently find their welcome to be a false promise, however. Necromancers who long ago tired of animating the same humanoids find new potential in mutated flesh, and mutants who aren't careful might find themselves led into laboratories or crypts for experimentation.

Enterprising twilight sages of Yled's Mortuarium have innovated bizarre combinations of alchemy and necromancy that boost their victims' mutations to persist even after reanimation. Although these necrohulks are virtually mindless and require a constant influx of chemicals to retain their might, they're more than powerful enough to make the extremely difficult process worth the effort. The cartridge containing the alchemical formulation that sustains them is perhaps the trickiest part of necrohulk animation, and it's easiest to simply stitch the cartridge right into the necrohulk's flesh.

Yled's armies contain a growing number of necrohulks. This isn't solely because these juggernauts are frightening effective combatants on the field of battle; leveraging the instinctive revulsion that mutants create carries some strategic advantage. Although the occasional necrohulks do run amok in Yled, addled on the chemical cocktails that sustain them, military necromancers generally keep them under control.

action->Alchemical Cartridge.name: Alchemical Cartridge
action->Alchemical Cartridge.description: Critical hits rupture the necrohulk's alchemical cartridge. The first time the necrohulk takes a critical hit, it loses its regeneration. The second time it takes a critical hit, it takes @Damage[15[persistent,acid]]{15} damage that it can't heal unless the cartridge is stitched back into place.

action->Smashing Blow.name: Smashing Blow
action->Smashing Blow.description:
The necrohulk smasher makes a fist Strike. If it hits, the necrohulk smashes the target into the floor or nearby wall. The target takes an additional @Damage[6d10[bludgeoning]] damage, depending on its @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The target takes half of the additional damage.

Sukces The target takes half the additional damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1}.

Porażka The target takes full additional damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 3}, and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}.

Krytyczna Porażka The target takes double the additional damage, is stunned 3, and knocked prone.

action->Teach You a Lesson.description:

Częstotliwość raz na rundę

1 @Damage[(2d12+14)[bludgeoning]] damage
