action->Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
action->Troop Movement.description: Whenever the troop Strides, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

action->Troop Spellcasting.name: Troop Spellcasting
action->Troop Spellcasting.description: When the necromancer troop Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius isn't affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that's normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Necromunculus.name: Necromunculus
Necromunculus.languages: (nie potrafi mówić w żadnym języku); undead master link
Necromunculus.publicNotes:
A necromunculus is a tiny undead servant that can only be created by an undead creature. These servitors are common creations in Geb, where undead crafters and masterminds have countless years to dabble in necromantic crafts and a great need for unquestioning loyalty from servitors more cunning than other simple undead minions.

Necromunculi are similar to homunculi, but there are a few notable differences between these undead creatures and the constructs they are named after. A necromunculus may be loyal to its master, but it also seethes with hatred for all undead, including itself. If left to its own devices, a necromunculus immediately begins plotting to kill and gnaw upon any undead with whom it must regularly interact, even its master, even though it has no need to eat. A necromunculus cannot willingly act on this urge so long as it has some other command to obey, so their creators work hard to ensure that they are constantly supplied with tasks to keep them occupied.

Despite their cannibalistic urges, necromunculi are gaining increased in popularity among Geb's undead necromancers. Each creator wishes to see if they can imbue even more of their powers or personality in the delightfully treacherous servants. Besides, they make excellent practice in espionage and logical thinking for would-be Blood Lords.

Necromunculi resemble skeletal, impish humanoids with leathery wings. They are created from a mixture of mud, bonemeal, juniper oil, a few drops of blood from a still-living mammal, and a pound of the creator's own flesh, blood, or bone. Undead creatures lacking a corporeal body can use a pound of flesh, blood, or bone from another willing, intelligent undead subject, but the process generally destroys the volunteer.

action->Undead Master Link.name: Undead Master Link
action->Undead Master Link.description: A necromunculus can't speak, but it is telepathically linked to its undead creator. It can share information back and forth, including its master's knowledge and everything the necromunculus hears. The range of this link is 1 500 feet. If the necromunculus is destroyed, the master takes @Damage[2d10[mental]] damage. If the master is slain, the necromunculus becomes mindless and wanders aimlessly in search of undead to attack and try to eat.

action->Stupefying Touch.name: Stupefying Touch
action->Stupefying Touch.description: A creature damaged by a necromunculus's claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:15] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} for 1 round.

Night's Breath Trap.name: Night's Breath Trap
Night's Breath Trap.description: The night giant mummy unfolds its arms and leans forward to exhale a blast of gray mist and shrieking spirits into the room.
Night's Breath Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] to "blind" the statue so that it cannot notice any who approach, @Check[occultism|dc:35] to redirect and expend the trap's occult energies harmlessly, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (7. level, counteract DC 32) to counteract the trap.
Night's Breath Trap.reset: The trap resets during the following round, after which it can be triggered again.

action->Night's Breath.name: Night's Breath
action->Night's Breath.description:
Aktywator A Small or larger creature in area A2 moves within 15 feet of the secret door to the north or the double door to area A5

Efekt The mummy exhales a blast of gray mist into the room that imparts an overwhelming sense that night itself is consuming all thought. The trap deals @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage to all creatures in area A2, who each must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] saving throw.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 1}.

Porażka The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Uciekający} for as long as they remain frightened.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes double damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 3}, and is fleeing for as long as they remain frightened.

Nightmare Portal.name: Nightmare Portal
Nightmare Portal.description: Horrific visions of a lumbering monstrosity whose face is nothing but a fanged mouth lurch out of the violet mist to attempt to eat the viewer alive.
Nightmare Portal.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:42|name:Focus the Portal's Energy|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to focus the portal's energies back in on itself to close it off, or @Check[occultism|dc:36|name:Invoke the Proper Chant] (master) to invoke the proper chant and make the proper hand gestures to untether the portal from the Dreamlands, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (8. level; counteract DC 34) to counteract the portal for 1 minute and prevent Orgesh's influence from reaching through during that time
Nightmare Portal.reset: The nightmare portal resets 1 minute after it no longer detects targets.
Nightmare Portal.routine: (2 actions) A vision of an immense lumbering figure with nothing but a circular mouth for a face lurches out of the portal. For each action, the nightmare portal casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} (heightened to 8. level, @Check[will|dc:38|traits:death,emotion,fear,mental]), targeting a different creature both times. It can select targets in area E11, the secret alcove to the northeast, or up to 10 feet east from the door (although a closed door blocks it), choosing the closest two targets each round. The nightmare portal loses 1 action if it's broken and can thus only cast phantasmal killer once per round.

action->Dreadful Vision.name: Dreadful Vision
action->Dreadful Vision.description:
Aktywator At the start of a round after a creature who can dream and isn't immune to sleep effects enters the room, the portal starts to glow with purple mist. At this point, the portal triggers as soon as such a creature looks into it. A character who just passes by and doesn't specifically avert their gaze must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11] to not accidently glance into the portal, while a character who Searches this room automatically looks into it unless they specify otherwise.

Efekt The nightmare portal casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity} (heightened to 8. level, @Check[will|dc:37|traits:mental]), making reality appear to crumble away to reveal a vast cavern filled with bones through which immense wormlike creatures burrow as they endlessly eat away at the world. The trap then rolls initiative.

action->Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
action->Swift Sneak.description: The archer can move their full Speed while Sneaking.

action->Spry Dodge.name: Spry Dodge
action->Spry Dodge.description:
Aktywator The archer is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see

Efekt The archer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the archer can Step.

action->Sneak Attack.description:

action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} to the archer.

Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

action->Bravery.name: Bravery
action->Bravery.description: Whenever the defender rolls a success at a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the frightened condition, they reduce its value by 1.

action->Offensive Line.name: Offensive Line
action->Offensive Line.description: The defender's Strikes deal an extra 1k6 damage when adjacent to an ally.

Nydazuul.name: Nydazuul
Nydazuul.publicNotes: The brutish and gluttonous augnagar live to feast- preferably on rotten flesh, and when possible, demon flesh. But to them, the greatest delicacy is the flesh of other augnagars. Augnagars have spiderlike legs with leathery membranes like a bat's wings, and three tails ending in hooked claws perfect for slicing flesh.

action->Confusing Display.name: Confusing Display
action->Confusing Display.description:
The augnagar's writhing limbs and flesh seethe and squirm in a disorienting and unsettling manner. Creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Confusing Displays for 1 minute.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} for 1 round.

Porażka The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Zdezorientowany} for 1 minute.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure, but the creature can't attempt a flat check to recover from confusion whenever it takes damage from an attack or spell.

action->Inhale Vitality.name: Inhale Vitality
action->Inhale Vitality.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt The augnagar inhales sharply, drawing life force out of creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:50]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[11d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save, and the creature is fatigued on a failure). The augnagar becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Przyspieszony} for 1 round on its next turn, and it can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

action->Rotting Curse.name: Rotting Curse
action->Rotting Curse.description:
Rzut Obronny @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Stadium 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1} (1 dzień)

Stadium 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 2} and the creature displays hideous, festering wounds exuding a horrific stench. Any creature within 30 feet of the victim must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} on a critical failure, for as long as it's sickened).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute. The victim of the disease doesn't roll a save, but takes the failure effects automatically and can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 dzień).

Opkherab.name: Opkherab
Opkherab.publicNotes:
When a living, sentient humanoid is exposed to an extreme expression of supernatural evil, the experience can irrevocably damn the victim, crushing their mind and ripping out their soul in an appalling, unholy transformation that results in a creature that's anathema to life-the bodak.

The shreds of physicality that survive this absolute corruption serve only to enhance the humanoid's profoundly disturbing appearance. The bodak's body is horrifically twisted, as though it's locked in a convulsion of agony and terror. Its desiccated and hairless flesh bears an otherworldly, pearlescent sheen, strung taut across a malformed skeleton that reduces its gait to a slow shamble. But most disturbing of all are its eyes, set in a drooping, melted visage with scant remains of its former facial structure. These eyes, sunken deep into their sockets, nevertheless glow with an unholy light, stare with unremitting malevolence, and constantly weep noxious vapor.

Fragmented memories of a prior existence filtered through a vengeful hatred of the living lead the bodak to try to return to those places it once knew. If successful, it assaults former friends, acquaintances, and loved ones with its murderous gaze and an incomprehensible torrent of gibberish laced with vile curses, accusations, and threats-an assault that often leads to the victims rising as newly formed bodaks themselves.

action->Lifesense 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]
Lifesense 30 feet

action->Draining Peek.name: Draining Peek
action->Draining Peek.description:
Aktywator A living creature within 30 feet that Opkherab can perceive with his lifesense starts its turn

Efekt The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save. If it fails, Opkherab regains @Damage[3[healing]] Hit Points, and the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1}. Opkherab can't use Draining Peek for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Draining Peek]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Key Conditioning.name: Key Conditioning
action->Key Conditioning.description: Opkherab has a –1 circumstance penalty to attacks against anyone holding one of the bank's keys.

action->Sunlight Vulnerability.name: Podatność na Światło Słoneczne
action->Sunlight Vulnerability.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Opkherab can't use actions with the death trait and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time Opkherab ends its turn in sunlight. If Opkherab loses all its actions this way, he is destroyed.

action->Death Grip.name: Death Grip
action->Death Grip.description: When Opkherab Grabs a living creature, including a Grab to extend the effect on a grappled creature, he gains 3 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1}. This increases the value of the creature's drained condition by 1, to a maximum of drained 4.

action->Zombie Spawn.name: Zombie Spawn
action->Zombie Spawn.description: Any humanoid who dies while drained by Opkherab rises as an autonomous zombie 24 hours after their death. You might use this opportunity to allow the player to keep playing the same character, rebuilt with the zombie archetype.

Ostovite Nest.name: Ostovite Nest
Ostovite Nest.description: A nest of bones resembling an ant hill contains countless miniscule scavenger vermin with vicious, acid-dripping mandibles.
Ostovite Nest.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Topple the Mound] (trained) to topple the mound and destroy it
Ostovite Nest.reset: The hazard deactivates if there are no targets for its acid spew at the start of its turn. The hatchlings return to the nest, and the hazard resets. If damaged but not destroyed, the nest recovers @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points per hour as the hatchlings repair it.
Ostovite Nest.routine: (1 akcja) The hazard makes an acid spew Strike against the nearest creature.

action->Skittering Surge.name: Skittering Surge
action->Skittering Surge.description:
Aktywator A creature comes within 15 feet of the nest

Efekt A mass of skittering ostovite hatchlings crawls all over the nest, spewing acid in all directions. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the nest takes @Damage[(1d10+4)[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic]). A creature who fails the save also takes @Damage[1[persistent,acid]] damage. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Pain Milker.name: Pain Milker
Pain Milker.description: An eerie machine made of levers, crystals, and glowing bits of metal that, as one draws near, causes unsettling aches and pains.
Pain Milker.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to deactivate the machine, or @Check[perception|dc:38] (expert) to decipher the proper order in which the switches and dials should be adjusted in order to power the device down harmlessly
Pain Milker.reset: If the augnagar still lives and at least one crystallized agony is still functional, the pain milker resets automatically in a number of rounds equal to 7 - the number of remaining crystallized agonies.

action->Agonizing Overload.name: Agonizing Overload
action->Agonizing Overload.description:
Aktywator The pain milker is struck hard enough to take damage, or any of its dials and levers are adjusted carelessly

Efekt The pain milker emits a shrill whine and exudes a blast of violet light. All creatures in area B2 must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save. This DC is reduced by 2 if the machine is broken.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature takes @Damage[4d10[vitality]] or @Damage[4d10[void]] damage (whichever is more harmful).

Porażka The creature takes @Damage[8d10[vitality]] or @Damage[8d10[void]] damage (whichever is more harmful) and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 1}.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure but @Damage[16d10[vitality]] or @Damage[16d10[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 2}.

Perilous Flash Flood.name: Perilous Flash Flood
Perilous Flash Flood.description: Whether made up of water rushing through the streets that sweeps up dangerous debris along the way or a less natural substance bursting free of its container, this relentless flood batters everything in its path.
Perilous Flash Flood.disable: Three @Check[athletics|dc:35|name:Move Barricade], @Check[crafting|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade], or @Check[survival|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade] checks to move or construct barricades strong enough to create a shelter from the flood. While this creates a safe place to stand, creatures outside of the barricaded area may still be in danger depending on the nature and the source of the flood.
Perilous Flash Flood.routine:
(1 action) The flood advances forward 60 feet, crashing into all creatures within its area. Each creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save as the floodwaters pummel them and pull them downstream. The amount and type of damage dealt are based on the nature of the flood, and certain types of floods impose additional effects. The turbulent waters mean creatures within the area of the flood must attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Swim|traits:action:swim] check to Swim in order to move, and those who do not succeed at a check to Swim each round may drown.

This caustic flood dissolves flesh as it moves, dealing @Damage[1d12[bludgeoning],(1k12+8)[acid]]{1k12 bludgeoning damage and 1k12+8 acid damage}. Additionally, it deals @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage to creatures who critically fail their Fortitude saves.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature takes no damage.

Sukces The creature takes half damage.

Porażka The creature takes full damage and is moved 10 feet along with the water.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes double damage and is moved 20 feet along with the water.

action->Burst Free.name: Burst Free
action->Burst Free.description:
Aktywator A creature or effect breaks the flood's containment.

Efekt The hazard rolls initiative as the flood surges forth.

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate, Infused).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]

Phalanx of Phalanges.name: Phalanx of Phalanges
Phalanx of Phalanges.publicNotes:
Made up of hundreds of finger and toe bones, a phalanx of phalanges clatters along the ground in an eerily uniform manner.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

action->Predetermined Path.name: Predetermined Path
action->Predetermined Path.description: A phalanx of phalanges knows a single path on even ground no longer than 100 feet, as determined by its creator. The phalanx of phalanges makes no actions other than moving along this path or making Countless Digits attacks against creatures in its way. If impeded on this path or if it takes damage, the phalanx of phalanges is unbound from its path and is permanently berserk, attacking nearby creatures to the best of its ability.

action->Countless Digits.name: Countless Digits
action->Countless Digits.description: Each other creature in the phalanx of phalanges' space takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage (@Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]] damage if the swarm is berserk) (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]). On a critical failure, the target is thoroughly pinned by the phalanges, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Unieruchomiony} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17) or until any creature uses 2 Interact actions to scrape away the bones pinning them down.

Phantom Soldiers.name: Phantom Soldiers
Phantom Soldiers.description: Spirits of long-dead soldiers appear in the mist and attack intruders.
Phantom Soldiers.disable: @Check[intimidation|dc:45] (legendary) to scare off the soldiers or @Check[deception|dc:46] (legendary) to order the soldiers to stand down

action->Battle.name: Battle
action->Battle.description:
Aktywator A creature enters the area

Efekt Spirit soldiers lunge out of the mist and attack intruders. The spirit soldiers attempt a spear Strike against each creature within 30 feet.

action->Rejuvenation.name:

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ZIFaA4jDQjM0vq8q]

When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1k10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

action->Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
action->Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, Pokmit automatically attempts to counteract it, with a [[/r 1d20+29 #Counteract]]{+29} counteract modifier.

action->Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
action->Devastating Blast.description: Pokmit unleashes a @Template[cone|distance:30] of cold. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]). The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse

action->Pike Master.name: Pike Master
action->Pike Master.description: Pokmit's longspear reach increases by 5 feet until the start of his next turn, and he makes a single longspear Strike against any number of creatures. These attacks count toward Pokmit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

action->Pokmit's Discernment.name: Pokmit's Discernment
action->Pokmit's Discernment.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt Pokmit sizes up the defenses of a creature within 30 feet; he must know the creature is near, but need not be able to see it. Until the start of Pokmit's next turn, Pokmit's attacks against the target ignore any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Schowany}.

action->Ruinous Weapons.name: Ruinous Weapons
action->Ruinous Weapons.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Pokmit uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sexud7FdxIrg50vU]{Greater Frost} weapons runes. (These bonuses are included in his statistics above.)

action->Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
action->Weapon Master.description: Pokmit has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons he wields.

Prachalla.name: Prachalla
Prachalla.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

Efekt A wave of psychic energy slams into the minds of creatures in the chamber, dealing @Damage[(8d10+48)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:44|basic]). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 3}.

Pyrogeist.name: Pyrogeist
Pyrogeist.publicNotes: Born from the deaths of arsonists who died in the fires they started, pyrogeists are roiling infernos whose spectral fire emits no actual heat and harms only living creatures. Obsessed with sharing their torment with the living, pyrogeists haunt the area of their demise until whatever wrong they refuse to forgive has been righted, and they are finally put to rest. While pyrogeists can't set their own fires, they often use their terrifying illusory capabilities and telekinetic powers to lure their victims into setting themselves ablaze.

When a pyrogeist is destroyed, it reforms where it was destroyed after [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2k4 days}, fully healed. The pyrogeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Zionięcie
action->Breath Weapon.description: A pyrogeist can spit a cone of spectral fire in a @Template[cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[10d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic]). A creature that fails the save also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage and is subject to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Ogień Faerie} until the persistent damage ends.

action->Pyrokinetic Whirlwind.name: Pyrokinetic Whirlwind
action->Pyrokinetic Whirlwind.description: The pyrogeist transforms into a 40-foot tall vortex of spectral flame that appears to immolate everything within a @Template[burst|distance:10]. A creature within this area take @Damage[(2d12 + 20)[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic]).

action->Soul Consumption.name: Soul Consumption
action->Soul Consumption.description: The spirit of a creature that dies from damage dealt by the pyrogeist's Pyrokinetic Whirlwind is trapped within the pyrogeist as if subjected to the effects of the bind soul spell. This effect persists until the pyrogeist is destroyed or chooses to set the soul free. The spirit remains trapped whether or not the pyrogeist is using Pyrokinetic Whirlwind. A pyrogeist can contain only one soul at a time in this manner.

Restored Doll.name: Restored Doll
Restored Doll.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

Rotbomber.name: Rotbomber
Rotbomber.publicNotes: Disgusting and dangerous, rotbombers bound around on all four limbs, ripping off the pressurized and explosive necrotic pustules that grow out of their backs to lob them toward their enemies. When they explode, the pustules emit concussive blasts of force and deadly pestilence that can infect a victim. Though slow and overburdened by the intense weight of the pustules, rotbombers can move with a surprising speed when they need to hunt down their quarry.

condition->Slowed.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]

You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A rotbomber is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Pressurized Pustules.name: Pressurized Pustules
action->Pressurized Pustules.description: When a rotbomber takes acid, fire, physical or sonic damage, there is a chance a prematurely developed pustule bursts open, determined by a @Check[flat|dc:11]. All creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] must succeed at @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2}. A creature that gets a critical failure becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 3}. Any creature who attempts this save becomes temporarily immune to pressurized pustules for 24 hours.

action->Gaseous Smash.name: Gaseous Smash
action->Gaseous Smash.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt The rotbomber pulls two necrotic pustules from its body, one in each hand, and leaps into the air in an attempt to detonate them simultaneously on a hapless victim. The rotbomber Leaps up to 15 feet horizontally and 10 feet vertically to land in a square adjacent to a target creature and makes a necrotic pustule Strike against the target. If the Strike hits, it deals an additional @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage to the target. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of determining the rotbomber's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after the Gaseous Smash.

action->Necrotic Rot.name: Necrotic Rot
action->Necrotic Rot.description:
Necrotic rot withers and corrupts living tissue at an alarming rate. An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from necrotic rot until it has been cured of the disease.

action->Propulsive Pestilence.name: Propulsive Pestilence
action->Propulsive Pestilence.description: The pressurized necrotic gases within the rotbomber's pustules make them explode far more dramatically than most alchemists' bombs. The rotbomber's necrotic pustules deal splash damage to every creature within 15 feet of the target.

On a success, Ruby Strides up to 15 feet (or 30 feet on a critical success) without triggering reactions from her target due to her movement, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} against Ruby's next melee Strike before the end of her turn. Regardless of the result of her Acrobatics check, Ruby attempts a melee Strike against the target.

backpack->Bag of Holding (Type IV).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.34DA4rFy7bduRAld]

backpack->Bag of Holding (Type IV).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.34DA4rFy7bduRAld]

Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

Jeśli torba zostanie przepełniona lub uszkodzona, rozrywa się i niszczy, doprowadzając do nieodwracalnej utraty znajdujących się w niej przedmiotów. Jeśli zostanie wywrócona na lewą stronę, znajdujące się w środku przedmioty wysypują się bezpiecznie, ale torba musi zostać z powrotem przewrócona na właściwą stronę, zanim będzie można jej używać. Żyjąca istota umieszczona w torbie ma wystarczająco dużo powietrza aby oddychać przez 10 minut zanim zacznie się dusić, oraz może podjąć próbę Ucieczki o ST 13. Przedmiot znajdujący się w torbie nie zapewnia żadnych korzyści dopóki nie zostanie wyciągnięty. Przedmiot w torbie nie może zostać wykryty przez magię, która wykrywa jedynie rzeczy znajdujące się na tym samym planie.

Pojemność 150 Naręczy

action->Evasion.description: If Rumin rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

On a success, in addition to the normal effects, Rumin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 3} on a critical success), but on a critical failure he becomes enraged and gains a +1 status bonus to Strikes and damage rolls against foes for 1 minute, during which time he can't be mocked further.

Rust Hag.name: Rust Hag
Rust Hag.publicNotes:
Rust hags have a knack for technology. They make their homes in hollowed-out factories, abandoned tenements, and other sites of urban decay.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
Rust Hag.saveDetails: statusowe +1 do wszystkich rzutów obronnych przeciw magii

weapon->Arquebus.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ChTaE7jhvCjcS6jI]

This is a long rifle that offers more range than the average firearm, though the long barrel and ferocious kickback make the weapon particularly unsteady unless a tripod or other stand is used to stabilize it. The arquebus is one of the most commonly used long guns among the soldiers of Dongun Hold and Alkenstar.

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description: A rust hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0fYE64odlKqISzft]{Rusting Grasp}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Przywołanie Konstruktu} to her coven's spells.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

The rust hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Hagshot.name: Hagshot
action->Hagshot.description: Any firearm wielded by a rust hag gains the benefits of +1 striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Duchowego Dotyku} runes, and it functions properly no matter how rusty it gets. In addition, when a rust hag critically hits a target with a firearm, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1}.

action->Rusting Touch.name: Rusting Touch
action->Rusting Touch.description: A rust hag's touch causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If the hag succeeds at a Strike with her claw, she deals [[/r 2d6 #Rusting Touch Damage]] damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the hag hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against the hag's claw attack, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack. Objects made of skymetal, such as adamantine and orichalcum, are immune to rusting touch.

equipment->Stony Hag Eye.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]
Stony Hag Eye
equipment->Stony Hag Eye.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]

This item appears to be an ordinary semiprecious stone and is typically mounted on a brooch or ring, but the stone is, in fact, an eyeball. This illusion can be seen through with true seeing or similar magic, and anyone who interacts with the item feels its wet and sticky surface, allowing them to attempt to disbelieve the illusion (DC 19). Many hags claim a hag eye is more effective if plucked from a living, awake creature, but this is likely just a convenient excuse for sadism.

The hag eye produces no direct benefit for the wearer, but allows the hag who created it, or any member of her coven, can peer through the eye using the Seek action. This has no range limit, provided the hag is on the same plane.

Any damage dealt to the eye destroys it. If this happens while a hag is looking through it, the hag is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} for 1 hour.

A stony hag eye is fashioned from the eye of a creature, such a basilisk or medusa, with a petrifying gaze.

Aktywacja 2 (obezwładnienie, transmutation, wzrokowość)

Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt You target a creature within 30 feet that can see the stony hag eye. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:incapacitation,transmutation,visual] save. On a failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for 1 minute; on a critical failure, if the creature is already slowed, it's permanently petrified. Touching the stony hag eye to the petrified creature (a single action with the manipulate trait) removes the petrified condition.

Wymagania Wytwarzania You must be a hag, and the raw materials must include the eye of a creature whose gaze turns creatures to stone.

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description: Sahni adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk} to her coven's spells.

action->Bride's Bargain.name: Bride's Bargain
action->Bride's Bargain.description: Sahni can make a bargain with a willing creature of sound mind. The creature gives away a special quality-such as its courage, beauty, or voice-or sacrifices a loved one in exchange for a boon or a promise from Sahni. As long as Sahni keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore a lost quality is to defeat Sahni or make another bargain for its return. Loved ones sacrificed for Sahni's bargain can't be restored except with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}, or similarly powerful magic.

action->Curse of Futility.name: Curse of Futility
action->Curse of Futility.description:
Sahni gazes upon a creature, affecting it with an overwhelming sense that every action it takes is futile; that humiliating failure is their only possible future. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:25] save; the target doesn't need to be able to see Sahni.

Krytyczny Sukces The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to Sahni's Curse of Futility for 24 hours.

Sukces The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} for 1 round and then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Porażka The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2} for 1 minute.

Krytyczna Porażka The target is stupefied 2 for 1 hour and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} as long as it is stupefied.

action->Scattered Coven.name: Scattered Coven
action->Scattered Coven.description: As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Sahni the ability to cast the following spells as 3. kręgu occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Krzywdzenie}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Przywołanie Konstruktu}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}. If Sahni is the third hag they confront, the coven is broken and she lacks these coven spells.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]

You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

equipment->Net.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.T8EopYZLT137CsdW]

You can use a net either on its own or attached to a rope. When attached to a rope, you can use the net to [[/act grapple]] a Medium or smaller creature up to 10 feet away (instead of only adjacent creatures). You can continue to Grapple to keep your hold on the target so long as the target remains within 10 feet and you continue to hold the net. The grabbed creature gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Escape unless you are adjacent to them, and it can attempt a [[/act force-open dc=16]]{DC 16 Athletics} check to Force Open the net entirely. Once the target is no longer grabbed, the net is unwieldy until refolded as a Concentrate action that requires two hands; if used without being refolded, Grapple checks made with the net take a –2 penalty.

When the net is unattached, you can attempt a ranged attack roll against a Medium or smaller creature within 20 feet. On a hit, the target is off-guard and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it Escapes, and on a critical hit, it's also immobilized until it Escapes. The Escape DC is 16. A creature adjacent to the target can Interact to remove the net.

consumable->Potion of Water Breathing.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WQhnfj1LbrEzvh8z]

Aktywacja 1 Interakcja

This filmy, gray potion smells of an old fish midden and tastes even worse. After drinking this potion, you gain the effects of a 2. level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MZGkMsPBztFN0pUO]{Water Breathing} spell for one hour.

action->Entangling Net.name: Entangling Net
action->Entangling Net.description: A Sallowdrudge uses their net to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Pochwycenie} a Medium or smaller creature within 30 feet. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} until it Escapes (DC 16) or until an adjacent creature Interacts to remove the net. On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany} rather than grabbed. The Sallowdrudge can't use Entangling Net again until they take 1 minute to refold their net.

action->Spear Fisher.name: Spear Fisher
action->Spear Fisher.description: A Sallowdrudge attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Unieruchomiony} target rolls the attack roll twice and takes the better result.

Scrabbling Ribcage.name: Scrabbling Ribcage
Scrabbling Ribcage.publicNotes:
The ribs of a scrabbling ribcage are connected to either a sternum or vertebral column, but not both, allowing the ribs to function as legs.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

action->Scrabble.description:

Efekt The ribcage Strides or Climbs. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Iron Command.name: Iron Command
action->Iron Command.description:
Aktywator An enemy within 15 feet damages Seldeg

Efekt Seldeg puts an impertinent foe who dared harm him in their proper place. He commands the enemy to kneel in obedience. If they refuse, they must pay the price in pain and anguish. The triggering creature must choose one of the following options: the enemy kneels, dropping @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony} as a free action, or the enemy refuses and takes @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage. In addition, Seldeg's Strikes against the triggering creature deal an additional 3 damage until the end of his next turn. Seldeg chooses whether the additional damage is spirit or void each time he uses this reaction.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ZIFaA4jDQjM0vq8q]

When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1k10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

Shabti Slayer.name: Shabti Slayer
Shabti Slayer.publicNotes:
Shabtis raised among the secret Pharasmin sect of the Carters Consortium are trained to destroy undead and the necromancers who create them.

Shabtis are facsimiles of the rich and powerful, patched together from shards of other souls and offered as a sacrifice to the Boneyard to suffer for the sins of their creator. Shabtis are unaware they aren't the person they emulate, and most spend an eternity enduring the punishments owed to another while the soul they emulate escapes judgement. Some shabtis discover their nature and often become adrift, drowning in the feelings and memories of their foul creator, with no true purpose and identities of their own.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]

This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Final Rest.name: Ostateczny Spoczynek
action->Final Rest.description: A shabti slayer's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Duchowego Dotyku} property rune and deal @Damage[2d10[vitality]] damage to undead creatures.

action->Immortal.name: Immortal
action->Immortal.description: Shabtis don't age naturally and can't die of old age. Spells and effects that cause aging still affect a shabti as normal. They also can't be turned into undead.

action->Prayer-Blessed Blade.name: Prayer-Blessed Blade
action->Prayer-Blessed Blade.description:
Wymagania The shabti slayer has successfully identified an undead with Recall Knowledge

Efekt The shabti slayer prays to Pharasma to bless their weapon, enabling them to exploit the weaknesses of an undead they've identified with Recall Knowledge. If the identified undead has a resistance that can be bypassed by a special material or a weakness to a special material (such as cold iron, duskwood, or silver), weapons wielded by the shabti slayer count as that special material for 1 minute. If the creature has multiple materials that qualify, the shabti slayer chooses which material their weapon counts as for the duration.

action->Quick Draw.name: Szybkie Dobycie
action->Quick Draw.description: The shabti slayer draws a weapon using the Interact action, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Two-Weapon Flurry.name: Two-Weapon Flurry
action->Two-Weapon Flurry.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Wymagania A shabti slayer is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand

Efekt A slayer lashes out with both weapons. They Strike twice, once with each weapon.

Shabti Votary.name: Shabti Votary
Shabti Votary.publicNotes:
Shabti votaries are devout clerics of Pharasma who heal and protect their allies while destroying enemies of their faith. Although shabti votaries focus primarily on destroying undead, they remain a potent enemy against living foes.

Shabtis are facsimiles of the rich and powerful, patched together from shards of other souls and offered as a sacrifice to the Boneyard to suffer for the sins of their creator. Shabtis are unaware they aren't the person they emulate, and most spend an eternity enduring the punishments owed to another while the soul they emulate escapes judgement. Some shabtis discover their nature and often become adrift, drowning in the feelings and memories of their foul creator, with no true purpose and identities of their own.
Shabti Votary.saveDetails: +2 status to all saves vs. mental and possession

Shadow Heart.name: Shadow Heart
Shadow Heart.description: A heart of tumorous, shadowy tissue unleashes magic on nearby creatures.
Shadow Heart.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:26] or @Check[occultism|dc:26] (expert) to counter the heart's offensive magic, or @Check[religion|dc:28] (trained) to purify the area containing the heart. Four successes are required to disable it; after two successes, the shadow heart can't use its shadow lash Strike.
Shadow Heart.reset: The heart deactivates if there are no creatures present in the room. It resets in 1 hour.
Shadow Heart.routine: The shadow heart uses Battering Vortex, and then uses shadow lash on a random creature within range.

action->Shadow Pulse.name: Shadow Pulse
action->Shadow Pulse.description:
Aktywator A creature approaches within 10 feet of the heart

Efekt The heart gives a slow beat, and all creatures in the room must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1} and unable to take reactions for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 3} on a critical failure). The dark heart then rolls initiative.

action->Battering Vortex.name: Battering Vortex
action->Battering Vortex.description:
A swirling vortex of shadows forms around the heart, lifting all creatures in the room and slamming them forcefully to the ground, dealing @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] damage. Each creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save. Anyone adjacent to a wall may @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} with a successful @Check[reflex|dc:28] save; on a success at Grabbing an Edge, the creature uses a result one step better than the roll of their Fortitude save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature takes half damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}.

Porażka The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 1} for 1 round.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 3} for 1 round.

Shadow Hooks.name: Shadow Hooks
Shadow Hooks.description: Hooks of solidified shadow extend from the walls, hook into creatures, and pull, tearing them open.

action->Tearing Hooks.name: Tearing Hooks
action->Tearing Hooks.description:
Aktywator A creature reaches the hall's midpoint

Efekt The trap attempts a shadow hook Strike against each creature in the hall. On a critical hit, a creature additionally takes @Damage[1d10[bleed]] damage.

Shadow Lash.name: Shadow Lash
Shadow Lash.description: Four pillars manifest shadow lashes that attack intruders.
Shadow Lash.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:46] (legendary) to drain the magic from each shadow lash or @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each shadow lash
Shadow Lash.routine: (8 actions) This trap loses 2 actions each turn for each disabled shadow lash. Each shadow lash has 2 actions it can use to perform the following actions.

action->Long-Rage Lash.name: Long-Rage Lash
action->Long-Rage Lash.description: The lash lengthens, increasing its reach to 60 feet, and makes a lash Strike. The lash's length then reverts to normal.

action->Manifest.name: Manifest
action->Manifest.description:
Aktywator A creature other than Kemnebi enters the chamber

Efekt Four pillars manifest a writhing whip composed of solidified shadows. The trap then rolls initiative.

Shadow Leydroth.name: Shadow Leydroth
Shadow Leydroth.publicNotes:
In ancient times, a cabal of primalists imbued an amalgam of beasts with both supernatural might and a hatred of magic itself, hoping to achieve a potent weapon for use against arcane spellcasters. Effective beyond expectation, the first leydroths broke free and turned on their creators. Worse, the leydroths bred true, and these reclusive predators have long outlived their original creators.

Leydroths look like distorted, apelike felines with many-branching horns growing from the backs of their heads. Their thickly muscled limbs end in glowing claws.
Shadow Leydroth.saveDetails: statusowe +2 do wszystkich rzutów obronnych przeciw magii

action->Magic Sense.name: Magic Sense
action->Magic Sense.description: The leydroth detects the source and school of each source of magic within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Czyhanie w Cieniach
action->Slink in Shadows.description: The Shadow Leydroth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Schować Się} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Przekradanie Się} in a creature's or object's shadow.

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Menace to Magic.name: Menace to Magic
action->Menace to Magic.description:
Aktywator A creature within 60 feet Casts a Spell

Efekt The leydroth attempts an @Check[intimidation] check to counteract the triggering spell.

action->Dispelling Roar.name: Dispelling Roar
action->Dispelling Roar.description:
The leydroth unleashes a bestial roar that reverberates within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. It rolls an Intimidation check and compares the result to the Will DC of each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizacja}.

It also uses this result to attempt to counteract each spell or magical effect in the area, plus one item or effect on each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}.

The leydroth can't use Dispelling Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dispelling Roar]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Dispelling Strike.name: Dispelling Strike
action->Dispelling Strike.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Aktywator The leydroth hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a Strike

Efekt The leydroth casts its innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii}, targeting one effect on the creature struck.

action->Spell Feedback.name: Spell Feedback
action->Spell Feedback.description: Any time a leydroth counteracts a spell or item, the spell's caster or the creature holding the item takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:38|basic] save).

Shadow Worm.name: Shadow Worm
Shadow Worm.publicNotes: Shadow worms are monstrous cave worms that dwell on the Shadow Plane. Larger and more cunning than most cave worms, shadow worms are fearsome predators that leave swaths of devastation in their wake. Most have glossy, black-armored hide, but those that burrow near velstrac lands are streaked with dark red, for the blood the velstracs spill has soaked into the very stones these shadow worms consume.

action->Tremorsense (Imprecise) 100 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense (Imprecise) 100 feet

action->Inexorable.name: Inexorable
action->Inexorable.description: The shadow worm recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Unieruchomiony} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

action->Shadow Healing.name: Shadow Healing
action->Shadow Healing.description: As long as a shadow worm is in an area of dim light or darkness, it gains fast healing 20. When affected by a magical shadow effect from anything other than itself, a shadow worm becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Przyspieszony} 1 for 1 round.

action->Shrink from the Light.name: Shrink from the Light
action->Shrink from the Light.description: A shadow worm takes an additional 20 damage from any spell or ability with the light trait and uses the outcome one degree worse for saving throws made against a spell or ability with the light trait.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Zionięcie
action->Breath Weapon.description: The shadow worm exhales a blast of clinging shadow, dealing @Damage[11d6[cold],10k6[void]]{11k6 cold damage and 10k6 void damage} to creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic]). If the cone passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by magical light, Breath Weapon attempts to counteract the light ([[/br 1d20+34 #Counteract]]{+34} counteract modifier). The shadow worm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
action->Fast Swallow.description:
Aktywator The shadow worm Grabs a creature

Efekt The worm uses Swallow Whole.

action->Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
action->Rock Tunneler.description: A shadow worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Huge, @Damage[(3d10+15)[bludgeoning]], Rozdarcie 42

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Thrash.name: Thrash
action->Thrash.description: The worm makes a Strike once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with its jaws and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

Shadowbound Monk Statue.name: Shadowbound Monk Statue
Shadowbound Monk Statue.publicNotes:
As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Ożywione przedmioty, obdarzone namiastką życia w wyniku zastosowania rytuałów lub innej osobliwej magii, wystąpują w wielu postaciach i mają różnorakie zastosowania. Wiele z tych istot pełni rolę strażników, zaskakujących nieświadomych poszukiwaczy przygód nagłym atakiem. Inne stanowią dla wyjątkowo bogatych źródło rozrywki, prostą służbę stworzoną do wykonywania prymitywnych zadań i tym podobne.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Pancerz Konstruktu (Twardość 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: statue posiada Twartość, tak jak zwykłe obiekty. Twardość ta zmniejsza wszelkie otrzymane przez niego obrażenia o wartość równą tej Twardości. Kiedy Punkty Żywotności statue zostaną zmniejszone do wartości poniżej połowy ich maksimum, lub natychmiastowo przy odniesieniu obrażeń od trafienia krytycznego, jego pancerz konstruktu uszkadza się zmniejszając jego Klasę Pancerza do 24.

action->Clinging Gloom.name: Clinging Gloom
action->Clinging Gloom.description: The statue pulls a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} into its grasping shadows. The target takes @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,void]] damage.

action->Cowl of Shadow.name: Cowl of Shadow
action->Cowl of Shadow.description: Shifting shadows cover the statue. If the statue is dealt at least @Damage[15[vitality]] damage or brought within an area of magical light, the shadows recede, and the statue can't make darkness mote attacks or use Clinging Gloom.

Shadowforged Guardian.name: Shadowforged Guardian
Shadowforged Guardian.publicNotes:
Shadowforged guardians are created through the intricate and dangerous process of siphoning penumbral energies and matter from the Shadow Plane and then binding them to a physical skeleton of wood and metal.

The first shadowforged guardians were created thousands of years ago in Nidal and were usually crafted in the likeness of that nation's patron deity, Zon-Kuthon. Shadowforged guardians are understandably in high demand; unfortunately, only the person who speaks a special word or phrase at the moment of the construct's creation can command it. Those who know the hidden formula to craft these constructs guard the secret well and only a few shadowcasters deign to create these guardians on another person's behalf-for a hefty price.

action->Eager Shadows.name: Eager Shadows
action->Eager Shadows.description: The shadowforged guardian increases all of its Speeds by 30 feet during the first round of combat after rolling initiative.

action->Induction Word.name: Induction Word
action->Induction Word.description: Each shadowforged guardian is activated during creation by a special word or short phrase spoken by its creator, and hearing this induction word resets its functions. If the guardian hears a creature within 30 feet utter its induction word, the guardian must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 3} on a critical failure). Regardless of the result of this save, it's immune to utterances of its induction word until the end of its next turn.

action->Twilight Aura.name: Twilight Aura
action->Twilight Aura.description: 30 feet. The shadowforged guardian's presence dims light and brightens shadows to a strange, twilit half-light. Light can't emanate brighter than dim light in this area while darkness is simultaneously illuminated to dim light. The shadowy aura automatically attempts to counteract any 5. kręgu or lower magical light or darkness effect brought into this aura or created in this area (counteract check [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21}, 5. level). As long as the guardian is in dim light, it gains a fly Speed of 30 feet.

action->Shadow Breath.name: Shadow Breath
action->Shadow Breath.description:
The shadowforged guardian expels a @Template[cone|distance:30] of twisting shadows from its mouth. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save. The guardian can't use Shadow Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shadow Breath]]{1k4 rounds}.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 1} until the end of its next turn.

Porażka The creature is enfeebled 1 for 1 hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for 1 minute.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 2} for 24 hours and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 2} for 1 minute.

Shimmernewt.name: Shimmernewt
Shimmernewt.publicNotes:
Native to the coastal provinces of eastern Holomog, these strange amphibians have frilled, iridescent gills that appear asymmetrically on either side of their bodies. Random arrays of spots, stripes, and other patterns decorate their flanks, and it's said no two shimmernewts have the same coloration. Originally, shimmernewts were ordinary (if oversized) amphibians, living their lives between brackish coastal lakes or tidal pools and the steamy jungles nearby. Over time, the ambient chaotic energies flowing through Holomog magically altered their evolution. The shimmernewts of today barely resemble their ancestors.

Their inherent chaotic nature has resulted in shimmernewts operating on different cycles from one another. Some are diurnal, some are nocturnal, but most are crepuscular. Shimmernewts that live close to peaceful humanoid settlements are often docile, but wild populations, whether deep in the jungle or in proximity to more violent settlements, can be quite aggressive. When provoked, all shimmernewts can inflate their gills in impressive displays to appear more attractive to mates or more intimidating to rivals. The capricious amphibians lack any natural predators, and conservation- minded locals are trying to prevent them from migrating further inland.

Some underground rings host shimmernewt fights, an unsavory form of entertainment made alluring by lucrative betting. Strolling down the docks of any port town in Holomog for a few minutes provokes whispered invitations to these fights. Though many locals decry these fights as inhumane, each time a ring is shut down, another group pops up sooner or later.

action->Gaping Chomp.name: Gaping Chomp
action->Gaping Chomp.description:
The shimmernewt chews on a creature that it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}. The target creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature takes no damage.

Sukces The creature takes @Damage[1d10[piercing]] damage.

Porażka The creature takes @Damage[2d10[piercing]] damage and @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes @Damage[4d10[piercing]] damage, @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2} by the pain of the chomp.

action->Shimmer Step.name: Shimmer Step
action->Shimmer Step.description: The shimmernewt surges forward so quickly it slips through space, teleporting to a target for an unexpected attack. The shimmernewt teleports to an empty space adjacent to a creature it can see within 60 feet, then attempts a jaws Strike against the creature. The target creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} against this Strike.

action->Trip.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]

Wymagania You have at least one hand free. Your target can't be more than one size larger than you

You try to knock a creature to the ground. Attempt an Athletics check against the target's Reflex DC.

Krytyczny Sukces The target falls and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony} and takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Sukces The target falls and lands prone.

Krytyczna Porażka You lose your balance and fall and land prone.

Shoki.name: Shoki
Shoki.publicNotes:
Shokis are shepherds who lead wayward souls to the Boneyard.

Psychopomps preside over death and the cycle of souls.
Shoki.saveDetails: statusowe +1 do wszystkich rzutów obronnych przeciw magii

spell->Plane Shift (Self And Locked Soul.target: 1 willing creature, or up to 8 willing creatures joining hands

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kcelf6IHl3L9VXXg]

equipment->Countless Religious Symbols.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]
