equipment->Countless Religious Symbols.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]

This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Lifesense 60 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]
Lifesense 60 feet

action->Infuse Staff.name: Infuse Staff
action->Infuse Staff.description: A shoki's staff becomes a +1 striking staff and is treated as if it were adamantine while the shoki wields it. A shoki's staff has Hardness 14 and HP 56 (BT 28) while possessed by the shoki or Hardness 5 and HP 20 (BT 10) while out of the shoki's possession. A shoki whose staff is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

action->Soul Lock.name: Soul Lock
action->Soul Lock.description:
Wymagania The shoki doesn't have a soul locked within their staff

Efekt The shoki attempts to capture the soul of a creature on the brink of death: either an undead creature, a creature with the dying condition, or a creature who died within the last minute. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32] save with the following results.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock.

Sukces The shoki's staff tugs at the creature's soul but doesn't trap it. If the creature is living, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (or increases its doomed condition by 1). If the creature is a corporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 2}. If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock for 24 hours.

Porażka The shoki captures the creature's soul in its staff. If the creature is living, it dies. If the creature is a corporeal undead, its body becomes an inanimate corpse. While the soul is locked in the staff, the target can't be returned to life or undeath, or rejuvenate through any means, save for powerful magic, such as miracle or wish. If the shoki's staff is destroyed or the shoki wills it, the soul is released. A shoki's staff can only hold one soul at a time.

action->Spirit Touch.name: Widmowy Dotyk
action->Spirit Touch.description: A shoki's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Duchowego Dotyku} property rune and deal @Damage[2d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[2d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Shrieking Souls.name: Shrieking Souls
Shrieking Souls.description: A terrified soul releases an earsplitting scream.
Shrieking Souls.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:44] (master) to comfort the spirit or @Check[occultism|dc:45] (master) to ward off the spirit

action->Scream.name: Scream
action->Scream.description:
Aktywator A creature enters the area

Efekt The spirit screams, dealing @Damage[(6d12+41)[sonic]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic]).

Sickle Blade.name: Sickle Blade
Sickle Blade.description: A skeletal arm holding a sickle is concealed in the ceiling and connected to a mechanism in the sliding door below it.
Sickle Blade.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) on the door frame or ceiling groove, or Interact to operate a lever on the opposite side of the door (in areas D2 and D4, respectively)
Sickle Blade.reset: The trap resets after 15 minutes. Additionally, a creature can manually Interact with the lever on the opposite side of the door to reset the trap.

action->Sickle.name: Sickle
action->Sickle.description:
Aktywator A creature attempts to open the door

Efekt A skeletal arm swings a sickle from the ceiling, making a Strike against the triggering creature.

shield->Steel Shield.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]

Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

TwardośćPŻPU
52010

armor->Full Plate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Gq1cZWSKOtJhKd2p]

Plate mail consists of interlocking plates that encase nearly the entire body in a carapace of steel. It is costly and heavy, and the wearer often requires help to don it correctly, but it provides some of the best defense armor can supply. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

action->Lancer.name: Lancer
action->Lancer.description: The skeletal knight uses a lance in one hand, even when it isn't mounted. If the skeletal knight critically hits a creature with its lance Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 1} until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

action->Circling Assault.name: Circling Assault
action->Circling Assault.description: The corpsekiller circles around their target then attacks, throwing their foe off balance and puncturing its defenses. The corpsekiller Steps or Strides, then attempts a glaive Strike. On a hit or critical hit, the Strike ignores 10 of their target's resistances. Regardless of the result of the Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} for 1 round.

action->Corpsekiller.name: Corpsekiller
action->Corpsekiller.description: A corpsekiller's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Duchowego Dotyku} property rune and deal an additional @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage to undead creatures.

action->Flamboyant Reposition.name: Flamboyant Reposition
action->Flamboyant Reposition.description: With a flourish, a celebrant shrouds themself in a puff of smoke, glitter, or colorful ribbons. If the celebrant is adjacent to an enemy, they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Finta} that adjacent enemy. The celebrant Steps or Strides; they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} during this movement.

spell->Feeblemind.name:

action->Bolster Dead.name: Bolster Dead
action->Bolster Dead.description:
Częstotliwość once per turn

Wymagania Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Efekt You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the rank of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Opróżnienie Przedmiotu Więzi
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Wymagania The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Efekt The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

Skewering Hall.name: Skewering Hall
Skewering Hall.description: A dozen spears hidden within sockets in the walls thrust into the hall when the pressure plate is triggered.

action->Skewer.name: Skewer
action->Skewer.description:
Aktywator Pressure is applied to the pressure plate

Efekt A dozen spears extend into the hall, making one spear Strike against each creature in the hall, up to a total of 12 spear Strikes.

Skull Fairy.name: Skull Fairy
Skull Fairy.publicNotes:
Skull fairies are malicious beings spawned from the heads of those who die after exposure to the malignant energies of the Shadow Plane. They aren't fey, but their petite, winged forms and tendency for malevolent mischief has caused the appellation "skull fairy" to stick.

After bursting from the skull of the deceased, a skull fairy seeks out victims to behead. Skull fairies enjoy nothing more than the horrific sound of wrenching a head free from a body. They often wear the skulls of their most recent victim like caps atop their bulbous, oversized heads. Skull fairies take heads they've acquired to isolated caves, where they carefully strip off the flesh and put the skulls on display. If the skull fairy feels the need for new headgear, they hollow out a fresh skull to wear and retire the old one to a place of prominence.

A group of exactly three skull fairies who have each been alive for at least 13 years become much more powerful than their solitary or younger kin. Members of such a coven become stronger and more intelligent, and they set their minds to evil and chaos on a much wider scale-although anything more complicated than wandering about to twist off heads might seem aspirational to a skull fairy. Skull fairies that join a coven gain the elite adjustments and often acquire more powerful innate spells. Nondetection and stinking cloud are the most common spells a skull fairy coven can access, but others exist. A skull fairy can only join a coven consisting exclusively of other skull fairies.

spell->Mage Hand.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mage Hand

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description: A skull fairy adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Zasłona Prywatności} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud} to their coven's spells.

action->Shadowy Pop.name: Shadowy Pop
action->Shadowy Pop.description: When killed, a skull fairy explodes into shadowy, noxious tissue like a burst bubble. Each creature within 5 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 3} on a critical failure).

action->Skull Twist.name: Skull Twist
action->Skull Twist.description:
Wymagania The skull fairy's last action was a successful fist Strike against a creature with a skull

Efekt The skull fairy wrenches the creature's neck, disorienting it. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 3} on a critical failure).

action->Terminal Tug.name: Terminal Tug
action->Terminal Tug.description: The skull fairy attempts to rip the head off an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Umierający} creature. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save. If it fails, it dies, and the skull fairy gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour.

Slamming Gate.name: Slamming Gate
Slamming Gate.description: The heavy gate slams shut when opened more than halfway
Slamming Gate.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|traits:action:disable-a-device|name:Loosen the Gate Springs] (trained) to loosen the gate's springs before it slams closed
Slamming Gate.reset: The trap can be reactivated (or deactivated, if it's active) by flipping a lever hidden in the nearby wall. A character Searching the area finds it with a successful @Check[perception|dc:18|traits:action:seek] check.

action->Slam Shut.name: Slam Shut
action->Slam Shut.description:
Aktywator The door is opened more than halfway

Efekt The door slams shut and deals @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage to any creature in the way (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany} by the closed door until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17)

Solar Glass Golem.name: Solar Glass Golem
Solar Glass Golem.publicNotes:
Crafted of hardened glass and held together by magically treated lead, glass golems are both deadly guardians and works of exquisite art. Glass golems most often protect grand cathedrals or opulent palaces-testaments to the wealth and power of those they serve, or once served. Once spurred into action by the commands of their creators, glass golems are quicker and more agile than most other golems. Their sharp, blade-like limbs can easily sever veins and arteries, creating wounds that bleed profusely.

Of all the various types of golems, the glass golem is the one most akin to a work of art. Just as powerful aristocrats might use an ice golem for temperature regulation or a wood golem as an ego-boosting statue, a glass golem's colorful glass construction can elevate the beauty of any chamber by its mere presence.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by sonic ([[/r 8d6]], [[/r 2d6]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area [[/r 2d6]] HP); slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for [[/r 2d6]] rounds instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

action->Spell Reflection.name: Spell Reflection
action->Spell Reflection.description:
Aktywator The glass golem is targeted by a spell

Efekt The glass golem positions its magical, reflective surfaces to turn the spell back on the caster. It tries to counteract the spell by attempting an Acrobatics check for its counteract check. If it successfully counteract the spell, the effect is turned back on the caster.

action->Vulnerable to Shatter.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
action->Vulnerable to Shatter.description: A glass golem is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell as though the golem were an unattended object.

action->Solar Flare.name: Solar Flare
action->Solar Flare.description:
The glass golem holds up its stained-glass frame and angles it downward, causing the image of the sun in the artwork to flash brightly, illuminating a @Template[cone|distance:30]. This blast of light deals @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage to creatures in the area, plus @Damage[4d6[vitality]]{4k6} additional vitality damage to undead creatures. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:30|traits:damaging-effect] save. If this solar flare overlaps an area of magical darkness, it attempts to counteract the darkness effect ([[/r 1d20+22 #Counteract]]{+22} counteract check).

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature takes half damage.

Porażka The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for 1 minute.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} permanently.

Sorvinaesen.name: Sorvinaesen
Sorvinaesen.publicNotes:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

action->Font of Death.name: Font of Death
action->Font of Death.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of void energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with void energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this void energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals @Damage[10d12[void]] damage energy in a @Template[burst|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

action->Impart Doom.name: Impart Doom
action->Impart Doom.description: A creature hit by Sorvinaesen's claw Strike, or one who critically fails a save from one of Sorvinaesen's spells, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

action->Visions of Death.name: Visions of Death
action->Visions of Death.description: Sorvinaesen's Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d10[mental]] damage to doomed creatures as visions of their impending deaths fill their minds.

Soul Slime.name: Soul Slime
Soul Slime.publicNotes: Soul slimes are swirling, blue-gray masses of protoplasm that feed on the quintessence contained within souls. Typically, soul slimes acquire this quintessence by consuming the living, the undead, or souls imprisoned in other objects, although soul slimes can also feed on the quintessence of the Outer Planes and their occupants. Soul slimes digest these siphoned souls over decades. As long as a portion of a soul remains undigested, a soul slime can adopt the shape and use the vocalizations of that soul — a tactic soul slimes routinely adopt to get close to their prey while hunting. As soul slimes lack the intelligence to truly impersonate or mimic the souls they digest, they are obvious facsimiles and are entirely incapable of speech.

action->Lifesense 60 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]
Lifesense 60 feet

action->Disgorge Soul.name: Disgorge Soul
action->Disgorge Soul.description:
Aktywator The soul slime takes physical damage

Efekt The impact causes the soul slime to release a burst of semi-digested soul fragments. The soul slime becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} until the beginning of its next turn. The soul slime can't use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Przekradanie Się}.

action->Disturbing Wail.name: Disturbing Wail
action->Disturbing Wail.description:
Wymagania The soul slime is using Soul Facsimile to adopt a creature's form

Efekt The soul slime releases an incoherent wail composed of countless overlapping noises made by the creatures whose souls it has siphoned. This disturbing cacophony deals @Damage[6d10[mental],6k10[sonic]]{6k10 mental damage and 6k10 sonic damage} to each creature in a @Template[burst|distance:30]{30-foot-radius burst} centered on the soul slime (@Check[will|dc:37|basic]). On a failed save, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 2}. The soul slime can't use Disturbing Wail again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Disturbing Wail]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Siphon Soul.name: Siphon Soul
action->Siphon Soul.description: A soul slime's touch siphons away portions of a creature's soul. Its Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Duchowego Dotyku} property rune and deal @Damage[3d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[3d6[vitality]] damage to undead and other creatures with void healing.

action->Soul Facsimile.name: Soul Facsimile
action->Soul Facsimile.description: The soul slime assumes the shape and features of any Large, Medium, or Small creature whose soul the soul slime has siphoned for up to 1 minute. This doesn't change the soul slime's statistics, only its outward appearance. While transformed in this way, the soul slime can revert to its natural shape as a single action, and the soul slime automatically reverts to its natural shape when it takes physical damage.

Soul Stasis.name: Soul Stasis
Soul Stasis.description: Four steel pillars emit pulsing energy to slow souls' processes.
Soul Stasis.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:43] or Religion (master) to reweave the magic within each pillar, @Check[thievery|dc:46] (master) to disable each pillar, or dispel magic (8. level; counteract DC 43) to counteract each pillar
Soul Stasis.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any souls in the area.
Soul Stasis.routine: (4 actions) This trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. Each pillar uses 1 action to emit a @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30-foot-radius burst} of inhibiting energy that slows souls. Each non-psychopomp creature with a soul in the area is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:43] save.

action->Pulse.name: Pulse
action->Pulse.description:
Aktywator A soul or creature with a soul enters the area

Efekt The steel pillars activate with an audible hum that resonates with spirits. Each non-psychopomp creature with a soul is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 3} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:43] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.name: Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.description: Four spirit collectors drain the souls from nearby creatures.
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.disable: @Check[religion|dc:47] (legendary) to sever the connection between Urgathoa and each spirit collector, @Check[thievery|dc:50] (legendary) to deactivate each spirit collector, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (9. level; counteract DC 50) to counteract each spirit collector
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.routine: (4 actions) This trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled spirit collector. Each spirit collector uses 1 action to drain the souls of all creatures within 30 feet, dealing @Damage[(4d10+20)[force]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:46|basic]). On a failed save, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} or increases their drained and stupefied conditions by 1 (by 2 on a critical failure).

action->Repulse.name: Repulse
action->Repulse.description:
Aktywator A creature damages a spirit collector

Efekt The damaged spirit collector releases a wave of force to repel the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(4d10+20)[force]] damage to the triggering creature, who must attempt a Reflex save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Krytyczny Sukces Efekt nie wywiera wpływu na istotę.

Sukces The creature takes half damage and is pushed back 5 feet.

Porażka The creature takes full damage, is pushed back 10 feet, and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes double damage, is pushed back 20 feet, and lands prone.

Spiraling Comets.name: Spiraling Comets
Spiraling Comets.description: Three blue comets orbiting the room turn red and attack when intruders enter.
Spiraling Comets.disable: @Check[religion|dc:42] (master) to command each comet to disperse with Pharasmin prayers, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (8. level; counteract DC 42) to counteract each comet
Spiraling Comets.routine: (3 action) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each comet disabled, counteracted, or destroyed. Each comet uses 1 action to attack the nearest intruder with a comet Strike.

action->Intruder Alert.name: Intruder Alert
action->Intruder Alert.description:
Aktywator An intruder enters the room

Efekt The comets change from blue to red in color. The trap then rolls initiative.

Straugh.name: Straugh
Straugh.publicNotes: When skirmishes break out between tunneling ghouls and creatures that dwell beneath the surface of Golarion, there's a chance that ghoul fever could infect such animals, producing strange new variants of ghoul beasts. However, letting the natural corruption run its course sometimes results in unsatisfying monsters, so some necromancers speed the process. This is the situation that led to the creation of the first straugh. A priest of Kabriri made the monstrosity to defend a claimed cemetery from another sect of ghouls who were preying upon the interred bodies. In some places, ghouls use straughs to tunnel into rival warrens or highly fortified mausoleums.

action->Consume Flesh.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ixPqVlqLaYTB1b23]

Wymagania The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Efekt The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[7d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

action->Fetid Screech.name: Fetid Screech
action->Fetid Screech.description:
Unaware that its vocal organs have withered and decayed, the straugh instinctively but ineffectively attempts to screech, instead releasing malodorous gas, half-digested corpse flesh, and small swarms of maggots from its open beak. The straugh releases a disgusting cloud of gas and decaying detritus in a @Template[cone|distance:15]; any creature within the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2}. On a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. Any creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune to Fetid Screech for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.lIEc8Lx3ROm17Dqa]{Efekt: Fetid Screech (Krytyczna Porażka)}

Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

action->Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
action->Rock Tunneler.description: A straugh can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

action->Tunneling Strike.name: Tunneling Strike
action->Tunneling Strike.description:
Wymagania The straugh has Burrowed underground and remains undetected by the creature it plans to attack

Efekt The straugh Burrows twice to emerge from the ground adjacent to at least one enemy and immediately makes a Strike against that foe.

action->Independent Brains.name: Independent Brains
action->Independent Brains.description: Each of Sulvik's heads rolls its own initiative and has its own turn. Neither head can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay}. At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls its own tongue and one of Sulvik's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever Sulvik's head (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon property) doesn't cause him to die if he has his other head, but does cause him to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. Mental effects that target a single creature affect only one of Sulvik's heads.

action->Mohrg Spawn.name: Mohrg Spawn
action->Mohrg Spawn.description: When Sulvik kills a living creature of 8th level or less, that creature rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.OaNtHZAraCrVLuSo]{Mohrg} after [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1k4 rounds}, on its turn. This mohrg spawn is under Sulvik's command. If Sulvik is destroyed, the mohrg spawn is destroyed as well, immediately collapsing into a pile of decayed flesh and bones.

action->Paralysis.name: Paralysis
action->Paralysis.description: A living creature hit by Sulvik's tongue Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each attempt.

Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).name: Summoning Rune (Cockatrice)
Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).description: A cloud of invisible magical sensors floats in the square above an invisible floor rune.
Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:18] to approach without triggering the trap followed by @Check[thievery|dc:20] (trained) to disrupt the rune's summoning effect; alternatively, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (2. level; counteract DC 17) to counteract the rune

action->Summon Monster.name: Przywołanie Monster
action->Summon Monster.description:
Aktywator A creature enters the cloud of magical sensors

Efekt The trap summons a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.MrzlaE7k1PEsd3iQ]{Cockatrice}. The cockatrice rolls initiative and remains for [[/gmr 2d6 #Summoning Duration]]{2k6 rounds}; after this duration, the spell ends and the cockatrice disappears. The cockatrice also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires. The cockatrice can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

armor->Padded Armor.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zBYEU9E7034ENCmh]

This armor is simply a layer of heavy, quilted cloth, but it is sometimes used because it's so inexpensive. Padded armor is easier to damage and destroy than other types of armor. Heavy armor comes with a padded armor undercoat included in its Price, though it loses the comfort trait when worn under heavy armor. You can wear just that padded armor or undercoat to sleep in, if your heavy armor is destroyed, or when otherwise not wearing the full heavy armor. This allows you to keep the armor invested and benefit from the power of any runes on the associated heavy armor, but no one else can wear your heavy armor without the padded undercoat.

consumable->Cognitive Mutagen (Moderate).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qpzL9UnTi4cDhy6J]

Aktywacja A Interakcja

Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral.

Benefit You gain a +2 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Pozyskanie Wiedzy}. Your critical failures on @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Pozyskanie Wiedzy} checks become failures instead.

Drawback You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

Duration 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.ztxW3lBPRcesF7wK]{Efekt: Cognitive Mutagen (Umiarkowany)}

action->Sacrifice Minion.name: Sacrifice Minion

Aktywator The teaching assistant is adjacent to a minion ally when they're targeted by an attack or an effect that requires a Reflex saving throw

Efekt The triggering effect is redirected to target the minion ally.

action->Necromantic Revitalization.name: Necromantic Revitalization
action->Necromantic Revitalization.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt The teaching assistant disperses void energy in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Living creatures in the area take @Damage[3d8[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic]); willing undead creatures in the area regain an equal amount of Hit Points.

Tenebric Giant.name: Tenebric Giant
Tenebric Giant.publicNotes: Necromancers reaching for the greatest heights of experimentation know that creating a new terror requires exacting, careful work at every stage of the process. In the case of the tenebric giant, this process begins with a tomb giant who dies after consuming a dose of several poisons combined with the shadow ash reagent. This creates the right circumstances for a necromancer to raise them as a tenebric giant. They're particularly obedient to the will of the necromancer who created them and are charged full of energy from the Shadow Plane, which grants them new powers and abilities.

0.label: to Hide in Dim Light or Darkness

action->Lifesense 80 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]
Lifesense 80 feet

action->Cloying Shadows.name: Cloying Shadows
action->Cloying Shadows.description:
The tenebric giant's attacks leave behind a residue of energy from the Shadow Plane. A creature hit by the tenebric giant's melee Strike takes an additional 1k8 persistent void damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save.

Krytyczny Sukces Efekt nie wywiera wpływu na istotę.

Sukces The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} until its next turn begins.

Porażka The creature is blinded for 1 minute.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature is permanently blinded.

action->Tenebric Stride.name: Tenebric Stride
action->Tenebric Stride.description: The tenebric giant can move quickly in shadowy conditions. The tenebric giant Strides twice and makes a scythe Strike at any point during this movement against a target that is in darkness or dim light. This movement doesn't provoke reactions.

Terra-cotta Soldier.name: Terra-cotta Soldier
Terra-cotta Soldier.publicNotes:
Terra-cotta warriors guard the tombs of ancient rulers, where they stand vigil, animating only when intruders break in to pilfer riches or defile the tomb itself. Each warrior is meticulously crafted from clay and given unique features.

A single terra-cotta warrior stands 6 feet tall and weighs 600 pounds.

shield->Steel Shield.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]

Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

TwardośćPŻPU
52010

Terrorguard.name: Terrorguard
Terrorguard.publicNotes: Spellcasters who harness the power of the Dimension of Dreams may use it to fuel vicious servitors known as terrorguards-hulking terrors adorned with frames made of an Abysium alloy. Terrorguards come in many forms; creators often design the constructs' frames to mimic grotesque aberrations by mixing-and-matching parts.

action->Breath of Phantasms.name: Breath of Phantasms
action->Breath of Phantasms.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt The terrorguard's ram-skull head opens at the jaw, allowing a horde of swirling phantasms to escape from its maw in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Each creature in the area is subjected to a 5. kręgu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} spell (@Check[will|dc:31], @Check[fortitude|dc:31|traits:incapacitation]).

action->Draw the Line.name: Draw the Line
action->Draw the Line.description: A terrorguard plunges its dreamscythe into the ground and rends a glowing line across the surface that reverberates with the essence of the Dimension of Dreams. Chose up to four unoccupied squares which are adjacent to one another and adjacent to the terrorguard. For [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1k4 rounds}, any creature besides the terrorguard who enters such a square must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 4} as they behold grotesque visions from the nightmare realm. A creature that succeeds at this save is temporarily immune to the effect for 24 hours.

action->Nightmare Essence.name: Nightmare Essence
action->Nightmare Essence.description: A creature damaged by a terrorguard's dreamscythe hallucinates that the environment and creatures around them have transformed into a hellscape reminiscent of their most horrifying dreams. A creature hit with a dreamscythe Strike must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Zdezorientowany} for 1 round. A creature who succeeds at this save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

action->Skull Charge.name: Skull Charge
action->Skull Charge.description: The terrorguard Strides twice in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

The Fight.name: The Fight
The Fight.description: Nearby creatures are caught in the memory of the struggle between Iron Taviah and the Benefactor.
The Fight.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:28] or @Check[religion|dc:28] (expert) in the room to drain away the haunt's spiritual energy. Each successful check reduces the number of actions in the haunt's routine; three successful checks are required to completely disable the haunt.
The Fight.reset: Unless completely disabled or destroyed, the haunt resets at the next moonrise at full strength.
The Fight.routine: (3 actions) The spectral Taviah uses 1 action to appear adjacent to a random creature within 30 feet if not already adjacent to a creature. It then uses its spectral claw Strike with its remaining actions.

action->Spectral Combat.name: Spectral Combat
action->Spectral Combat.description:
Aktywator A creature approaches within 10 feet of the spilled goblet

Efekt The desperation of the sudden fight fills the minds of all creatures in the dining room as the apparition of Iron Taviah at the north end of the table lunges. The haunt deals @Damage[4d10[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:30|basic]) to each creature in the room. On a failed save, the creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,mental]] damage. The haunt then rolls for initiative.

The Flight.name: The Flight
The Flight.description: The spectral figure of a handsome, well-dressed man flees down the stairs, clutching a wound in his side with one hand and making a shoving motion with the other. His shout drives creatures back.
The Flight.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:30] or @Check[religion|dc:30] (expert) to drain away the haunt's spiritual energy. This check can be attempted only from the top of the stairs behind the secret door.
The Flight.reset: The haunt ends as soon as there are no creatures within 60 feet. It resets when the secret door is closed.
The Flight.routine: (1 action) (divine, evocation, incapacitation, sonic) The spectral figure shouts, dealing @Damage[4d10[sonic]] damage to all creatures within 60 feet of the secret door (@Check[will|dc:28|basic|traits:divine,evocation,incapacitation,sonic]). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany} for 1 round.

action->Defensive Shove.name: Defensive Shove
action->Defensive Shove.description:
Aktywator The secret door to the basement stairs opens

Efekt The spectral figure's shout shoves every creature in the room away from the east wall. Creatures in the drawing room or the adjacent foyer must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature isn't moved.

Sukces The creature is pushed back 10 feet. If this movement would push it into a wall, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to the number of feet it was moved.

Porażka As success, but 20 feet and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}.

Krytyczna Porażka As success, but 20 feet, and the creature is knocked prone and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 2}.

The Putrid Rise.name: The Putrid Rise
The Putrid Rise.description: The stink of bile suddenly grows as the myriad mouths carved into the walls begin to vomit forth a deluge of acidic slurry.
The Putrid Rise.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to disrupt the trap's magical network of sensors and effectively "blind" it to targets to react to, @Check[religion|dc:38] (master) to recognize the carvings and recall one of the mantras needed to pass safely, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (7. level; counteract DC 32) to counteract the trap.
The Putrid Rise.reset: The trap deactivates 1 round after no targets can be sensed, but resets immediately.
The Putrid Rise.routine: On its turn, the trap Vomits as its action. As long as the Putrid Rise is active, the stairs in area D3 are difficult terrain.

action->Vomit.name: Vomit
action->Vomit.description:
Aktywator The trap's sensors notice a creature on the stairs north of the entrance to area D4

Efekt The myriad mouths on the walls spew out a foul-smelling acidic slurry along the entire stairwell. The stairs in areas D3 become difficult terrain, and all creatures in area D3 must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:34|traits:damaging-effect] saving throw. A creature that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Wyczerpany} by hunger takes a –2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw. The trap then rolls initiative.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature takes @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1}.

Porażka The creature takes @Damage[8d6[acid]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2}, and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes @Damage[16d6[acid]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 3}, is knocked prone, and then tumbles down the stairs. The fall ends once the creature reaches the next lowest landing (note that a creature falling at the lowest flight tumbles into the carrion pit at area D2, but can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} as detailed in that room). A creature that falls down the steps takes an additional @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic]) from the tumble, regardless of the total distance traveled.

Theater Phantasm.name: Theater Phantasm
Theater Phantasm.hpDetails: emotional consumption, dramatic return, leczenie pustką
Theater Phantasm.publicNotes: Theater phantasms are amalgamations of the spiritual and emotional energy given up by entertainers and audiences of powerful performances.

action->Bonded Theater.name: Bonded Theater
action->Bonded Theater.description: A theater phantasm can't travel more than 50 feet from the theater (or similar location) where it was created.

action->Catharsis.name: Catharsis
action->Catharsis.description: When a theater phantasm is destroyed, it emits waves of emotional energy. All creatures within 50 feet take @Damage[10d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:34|basic]) as they experience a crushing barrage of emotions.

action->Dramatic Return.name: Dramatic Return
action->Dramatic Return.description: A destroyed theater phantasm slowly reforms to full strength over the course of 1 week. The only way to permanently destroy the phantasm is to reduce it to 0 Hit Points during a performance occurring in its bonded theater.

action->Emotional Consumption.name: Emotional Consumption
action->Emotional Consumption.description: If a theater phantasm is within 100 feet of an audience of 20 or more intelligent beings witnessing a performance in its bonded theater, it gains fast healing 20.

action->Spotlight.name: Spotlight
action->Spotlight.description:
Częstotliwość raz na rundę

Efekt The theater phantasm draws attention to a creature it admires. The phantasm designates a target other than itself within 50 feet with a subtle spotlight, giving the target a +2 status bonus to Performance checks and resistance 10 to mental damage for 1 minute. If it uses this ability again on a new target, the former creature loses its spotlight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.irSKPLF5oLfnqUNW]{Efekt: Spotlight}

Time Rift.name: Time Rift
Time Rift.description: A time rift focused on the sundial causes time to pass erratically for all creatures in the area.
Time Rift.disable: Three @Check[thievery|dc:48] (legendary) or @Check[occultism|dc:48] (master) checks to mend the time rift.
Time Rift.routine:
(1 akcja) On its initiative, the time rift alters each creature's timeline. Each creature in the area rolls a [[/gm 1d4 #Time Rift Effect]]{1k4} to randomly determine the effect on them.

1 The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for 1 round.

2 Efekt nie wywiera wpływu na istotę.

3 The creature is affected erratically by time; they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} for 1 round.

4 The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Przyspieszony} 1 for 1 round.

action->Pause.name: Pause
action->Pause.description:
Aktywator A creature enters the area

Efekt The triggering creature becomes temporarily unmoored from time, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 3}. If the creature succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:47] save, they reduce this to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1}. The trap then rolls initiative.

Tombstone Troll.name: Tombstone Troll
Tombstone Troll.hpDetails: regeneration 5 (deactivated by acid, fire, or vitality)
Tombstone Troll.publicNotes:
Sometimes, when a troll is regenerating from life-threatening wounds inflicted by necromancy or void energy, the vile energy takes hold in the troll's supernaturally resilient regeneration. The force that should have killed the troll instead becomes a part of the troll's strange physiology. These trolls are not undead, but the force inside them eats at their bodies and souls, turning them into shrunken mockeries of their former selves. These so-called "tombstone trolls" resemble withered, diminutive trolls, bloated with starvation and obviously sickly. Their teeth, hair, and fingernails rot, fall out, and regenerate every few days in an endless cycle that is both painful to experience and sickening to see.

Other trolls shun and despise tombstone trolls, who earn their name from their habit of digging up graves in their search for an easy meal that can't fight back. Tombstone trolls shun confrontation of any kind, especially in areas where their grave-robbing might put them at odds with powerful undead. They often lair underground, safe in their graveyard burrows for days at a time, gradually tunneling through the earth to devour nearby corpses. If the tombstone troll is clever, the surface might not bear any evidence of their presence except for a few divots or soft spots in the soil. Once a tombstone troll has run out of easy pickings in a cemetery, it moves on in the dead of night to find a new hunting ground. If their travel is lengthy or difficult, their hunger might drive them to attack the living.

action->Death Feast.name: Death Feast
action->Death Feast.description:
Wymagania The troll's last action was a jaws Strike that damaged a living creature or a corpse

Efekt The troll deals @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage to the target as it swallows a mouthful of meat and converts it into void energy. Its jaws and claw Strikes deal 1 additional void damage for 1 minute or until it uses its Grave Breath, whichever comes first.

action->Grave Breath.name: Grave Breath
action->Grave Breath.description:
Wymagania The troll is bloated with void energy from a Death Feast

Efekt The troll breathes a @Template[cone|distance:15] of putrid, soul-chilling gas. Each living creature in the area takes @Damage[2d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:14|basic]). On a failure, the creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1}. The troll can't use Grave Breath until it uses Death Feast again.

Tylegmut's Last Meal.name: Tylegmut's Last Meal
Tylegmut's Last Meal.description: The former bank manager's ghostly presence tempts creatures to partake in a dubious meal.
Tylegmut's Last Meal.disable: @Check[religion|dc:18|name:Recite a Prayer to Urgathoa] (wytrenowanie) to say a prayer to Urgathoa and put the haunt temporarily to rest until it resets, @Check[occultism|dc:22|name:Commune with the Manager's Spirit] (wytrenowanie) to commune with the bank manager's spirit and convince her to permanently pass on, disabling the haunt
Tylegmut's Last Meal.reset: The haunt re-forms after 1 hour. The haunt becomes disabled and doesn't re-form if a creature eats a full meal at the desk-this can be any food, not just the "food" at hand.
Tylegmut's Last Meal.routine: (1 action) The haunt sends a cloud of dust and bone shards hurtling about the room. The dust and bones batter all creatures in the room, dealing @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic]). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure).

action->Foul Temptation.name: Foul Temptation
action->Foul Temptation.description:
Aktywator A creature looks over the contents of the desk

Efekt The haunt tempts nearby creatures to eat from the plates and bowls arrayed on the desk by concealing it in an illusion of food the viewer finds delicious. Each creature in area D5 must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature sees through the illusion entirely and is temporarily immune to the haunt's routine for 1 minute.

Sukces The creature is not tempted by the food.

Porażka The creature believes the food is appetizing and becomes driven to consume it. The creature takes @Damage[(4d4+4)[slashing]] damage as it chews the jagged bones and husks.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure, but the creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Sparaliżowany} for 1 round as the haunt continues to tempt it.

Umbraex.name: Umbraex
Umbraex.hpDetails: ashen rise, leczenie pustką, regeneration 20 (deactivated by fire or holy)
Umbraex.languages: (nie potrafi mówić w żadnym języku); telepatia 100 stóp
Umbraex.publicNotes: An umbraex appears at first glance to be a massive, majestic bird, much like a phoenix. Instead of compassion and warmth, however, it seethes with cold and hate. The umbraex is among the largest of the nihilistic undead called darvakkas.

Unfinished Portalrender.name: Unfinished Portalrender
Unfinished Portalrender.description: A sphere of concentrated agony harvested from a qlippoth begins pulsing with violet light as it blasts the room with otherworldly agony.
Unfinished Portalrender.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:37] (master) to dismantle the housing and refocus the agony inward so it consumes itself harmlessly, @Check[arcana|dc:33] or @Check[occultism|dc:33] (master) to vent the agony in a controlled way that causes the portalrender to become inert after 1 minute (during which it can still be triggered normally), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (7. level; counteract DC 31)
Unfinished Portalrender.routine: The unfinished portalrender continues to flood area B4 with agony, and everyone in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save against its Agonizing Pulse. At the end of its turn, the unfinished portalrender attempts a @Check[flat|dc:6]. On a failure, its stores of agony deplete and it deactivates, causing the central orb of agony to fade away permanently.

action->Agonizing Pulse.name: Agonizing Pulse
action->Agonizing Pulse.description:
Aktywator The unfinished portalrender takes any damage or is moved (the portalrender is Bulk 5)

Efekt The central sphere of concentrated agony flashes bright violet, filling the mind's of the room's inhabitants with overwhelming mental sensations of pain and hallucinations that the world around them is being torn away and replaced by a demon-haunted apocalypse. All creatures in area B4 must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save, then the trap rolls initiative.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage from the pain.

Porażka The creature takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage from the pain and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Zdezorientowany} until the end of their next turn.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes @Damage[16d6[mental]] damage from the pain, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1}, and is confused for 1 minute.

Unstable Fiendflame Cage.description: The Fiendflame Cage is uncontrolled, releasing holy light and hellfire in the area.
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:48], @Check[nature|dc:48], @Check[occultism|dc:48], or @Check[religion|dc:48] (master) four times on the Fiendflame Cage to calm it through ritual incantations
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.routine: (2 actions) On its initiative, the Fiendflame Cage uses 1 action to release a wave of hellfire, dealing @Damage[(2d10+12)[spirit],(2k10+12)[fire]|traits:unholy]{2k10+12 spirit damage and 2k10+12 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:15]{15-foot-radius burst} (@Check[reflex|dc:47|basic]). The Fiendflame Cage uses its second action to release a wave of holy light, dealing @Damage[(2d10+12)[spirit],(2k10+12)[fire]|traits:holy]{2k10+12 spirit damage and 2k10+12 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:15]{15-foot-radius burst} (@Check[reflex|dc:47|basic]).

action->Soul Ward.name:

Soul Ward
action->Soul Ward.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.FsqVhavMWAoFro1L]

An intangible field of necromantic energy protects a ravener from total destruction. A soul ward has 150 maximum Hit Points.

Whenever a ravener would be reduced below 1 Hit Point, all damage in excess of what would reduce them to 1 Hit Point is instead dealt to their soul ward. If this damage reduces the soul ward to fewer than 0 Hit Points, the ravener is destroyed.

A soul ward's Hit Points can be restored only via specific ravener abilities such as Consume Soul, ravenous breath, or vicious criticals. A ravener who goes more than a week without successfully using Consume Soul to feed on a dying creature starves, and their soul ward loses [[/r {1d4} #Soul Ward Decay]] Hit Points each day until they feed. If the ravener's soul ward loses all its Hit Points while the ravener still has more than 1 HP, they become a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.Yv0005Vym1peVKHq]{Ravener Husk}.

action->Consume Soul.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.VLCECgjkL5bNOxpx]
Consume Soul
action->Consume Soul.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.VLCECgjkL5bNOxpx]

Aktywator A living creature within 30 feet of the ravener dies

Efekt The ravener tears the creature's soul from its body with their maw and gulps it down. The dying creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save with the same DC as the ravener's Breath Weapon.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Sukces The ravener tears off a small chunk of the creature's soul. If the victim is restored to life, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1} in addition to any other side effects of returning to life. The ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to half the creature's level.

Porażka As success, but the creature's soul is ravaged. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 3} and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to the creature's level.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure, but the ravener devours the entire soul. The victim can't be restored to life as long as the ravener exists except via a 10. kręgu effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to twice the creature's level.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Smoczy Amok
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The ravener makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: The ravener recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

action->Ghost Bane.name: Ghost Bane
action->Ghost Bane.description: The ravener's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Duchowego Dotyku} property rune, and the ravener's jaws deal an additional @Damage[6d6[force]] damage to undead.

action->Ravenous Breath Weapon.name: Ravenous Breath Weapon
action->Ravenous Breath Weapon.description:
The ravener breathes in one of two ways. With either option, a creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 2} on a critical failure). If at least one creature is drained by the ravener's Ravenous Breath Weapon, the ravener's soul ward gains @Damage[5[healing]] HP. The ravener can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1k4 rounds}.

  • Void (necromancy, primal, void) The ravener breathes a blast of darkness in a @Template[cone|distance:40] that deals @Damage[17d6[void],4k6[persistent,void]]{17k6 void damage plus 4k6 persistent void damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic|traits:necromancy,primal,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[22d6[force]] damage instead of the void damage.
  • Shadows (necromancy, primal, shadow) The ravener breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:necromancy,primal,shadow] save.

    Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected.

    Sukces The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 2} for 1 round.

    Porażka The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

    Krytyczna Porażka The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} for 1 round.

action->Vicious Criticals.name:

action->Vicious Criticals.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.XbHMVjHtbPaPr9P5]

The ravener treats an attack roll as a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, as long as the attack roll was a success. Additionally, whenever the ravener makes a critical hit with one of their Strikes, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save or gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1} condition. If the target already has a drained value of greater than 0, their drained value instead increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 4}. Whenever the ravener applies drain to a creature in this way, their soul ward gains 5 Hit Points.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

Urglid.name: Urglid
Urglid.publicNotes: The hulking monstrosities known as urglids form from the souls of murderous undertakers, sadists who buried their victims alive, and intentionally neglectful grave keepers who gave up their watch over the dead. Standing over 30 feet tall and weighing over 3 000 pounds, the demon's head seems sunken into its torso, and a gaping, toothy mouth opens at the top of its chest.

action->Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
action->Earth Glide.description: The urglid can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, the urglid moves at their full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing unless they choose to do so.

action->Gravechoke.name: Gravechoke
action->Gravechoke.description: The urglid emits a putrid pulse that targets all living creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area that fail a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2} on a critical failure).

action->Ravenous Earth.name: Ravenous Earth
action->Ravenous Earth.description: With a single, devious thought, the urglid causes a mound of grave soil to well up at a creature's feet. A creature failing a @Check[reflex|dc:30] save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}. The restrained creature then begins sinking below the ground into a spontaneously formed grave. A creature restrained by this ability for three rounds is buried 6 feet deep in the ground and begins suffocating within 1 minute. A buried creature must be dug up to be freed. A creature who is slain by Ravenous Earth rises as a ghoul the next midnight.

action->Mist Escape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.sAyR4uJbsWukZFZf]

Aktywator The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Efekt The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.

action->Vampire Weaknesses.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5DuBTf37u88IrphJ]
Vampire Weaknesses
action->Vampire Weaknesses.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5DuBTf37u88IrphJ]

All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Uciekający} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1k6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

action->Change Shape.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ZMTnwyXjyfy7Ryi6]
Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ZMTnwyXjyfy7Ryi6]

The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Postać Zwierzęcia} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +21 attack bonus. These fangs deal the same amount of damage as the vampire's claws, but deal piercing damage rather than slashing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Create Spawn.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.wqptDG0IW6ExnISC]
Create Spawn
action->Create Spawn.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.wqptDG0IW6ExnISC]

If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|against:will|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

action->Dominate.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.AjTkksppymqzCivT]
Dominate
action->Dominate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.AjTkksppymqzCivT]

The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.268Q7HdtylwpznvG]

Unlike most other undead, a vetalarana isn't destroyed when they reach 0 HP. Instead, their body is destroyed, crumbling to ash, and their mind is immediately transferred into a creature they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts. This creature must be within 1 mile; if no such creature is in range, the vetalarana is destroyed. The creature becomes controlled by the vetalarana and loses the stupefied and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Nieprzytomny} conditions. If the creature controlled by a vetalarana in this way is killed, the vetalarana's mind transfers to another creature within 1 mile who they rendered comatose through Drain Thoughts.

Taviah has no comatose creatures to transfer her consciousness to.

After [[/gmr 1d6 #Days]]{1k6 days} of being controlled, the controlled creature dies, and its body transforms into that of the vetalarana who rendered it comatose.

action->Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
action->Bonds of Iron.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt Taviah can cause a cage built of cold-iron fingernails to spring from nothingness around a target at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Pochwycenie} against the target's Fortitude DC. If the target has a weakness to cold iron, Taviah gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Taviah doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature escapes (DC 29), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it; it has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

Efekt Taviah seizes a creature and consumes its memories. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2} if Taviah's Athletics check is a critical success), and Taviah regains @Damage[18[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess as temporary Hit Points. Draining Thoughts from a creature that is already stupefied doesn't restore any HP to Taviah but increases the victim's stupefied value by 1. Additionally, Taviah views one of the victim's memories, and can choose to alter, enhance, or erase the memory she views as a 4. kręgu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory} spell. A victim's stupefied condition value decreases by 1 every week.

A victim that becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 5} in this way is rendered comatose until Taviah is destroyed, becoming permanently unconscious. While unconscious, its stupefied condition doesn't decrease.

Vanth Warrior.name: Vanth Warrior
Vanth Warrior.publicNotes: Protecting the Boneyard are the stern and resolute guardians of the dead known as vanths, psychopomps who resemble skeletons with raven-like wings and a mask resembling a vulture's skull. Vanths carry black scythes to fight against those who would disturb the natural progression of souls, and they consider any visitor to the Boneyard a potential troublemaker. When the psychopomp armies go to war, vanths serve as front-line soldiers. They rarely speak and even more rarely show any emotion other than a grim adherence to duty.

Virulak Necromancer.name: Virulak Necromancer
Virulak Necromancer.publicNotes:
Virulak necromancers are often intrigued by the interplay between poison and undeath, testing toxins on their dead flesh or, more commonly, on hapless living victims. This virulak necromancer was once a sorcerer but now considers their bloodline irrelevant.

When a creature dies from poison, it sometimes rises as a virulak: an undead being infused with lethal venom. Most virulaks are solitary creatures with memories of an excruciating death. Occasionally, a mass poisoning produces numerous simultaneous fatalities, increasing the chance of many virulaks arising at once and working together in a dangerous mob. Entire villages might rise as virulaks when forced to subsist on food so spoiled it has become toxic or from an intentional scheme to poison the settlement.

Virulaks retain the intelligence and memory they had in life, but their agonizing death by poison transforms them into bitter mockeries of their former selves. Poison seeps from their fingertips and solidifies into hard claws. Virulaks are known for a cynical and ironic sense of humor. They delight in poisoning the good spirits and reputations of those around them, dealing psychological blows that mirror the venom in their bodies.

Virulak Villager.name: Virulak Villager
Virulak Villager.publicNotes:
A village of commoners raised to undeath by a mass poisoning might continue to go about the settled routines of life, posing an eerie scene for living creatures who enter their village. Virulak villagers prefer to attack with an advantage of numbers, but even a lone villager can pose a problem for unaware or inexperienced travelers.

When a creature dies from poison, it sometimes rises as a virulak: an undead being infused with lethal venom. Most virulaks are solitary creatures with memories of an excruciating death. Occasionally, a mass poisoning produces numerous simultaneous fatalities, increasing the chance of many virulaks arising at once and working together in a dangerous mob. Entire villages might rise as virulaks when forced to subsist on food so spoiled it has become toxic or from an intentional scheme to poison the settlement.

Virulaks retain the intelligence and memory they had in life, but their agonizing death by poison transforms them into bitter mockeries of their former selves. Poison seeps from their fingertips and solidifies into hard claws. Virulaks are known for a cynical and ironic sense of humor. They delight in poisoning the good spirits and reputations of those around them, dealing psychological blows that mirror the venom in their bodies.

action->Vampire Weaknesses.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5DuBTf37u88IrphJ]

All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Uciekający} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1k6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Efekt The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[16[healing]]{16 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.
