Wheel Archon.name: Wheel Archon
Wheel Archon.publicNotes:
Among the most terrifying archons to behold, and easily the most difficult for mortals to comprehend, is the wheel archon, so named for its appearance as a flying, armor-plated wheel of fire with eyes on each spoke. Wheel archons often serve as messengers or harbingers for the armies of heaven, as their stubborn, indomitable natures make them ill-suited for missions requiring diplomacy or tact. Indeed, they have a legendary intolerance and single-mindedness in the pursuit of the punishment of evil.

Wheel archons can't tolerate deceit and easily see through lies. The sensation of this celestial being's divine eyes all fixing upon a single target is usually enough to encourage honesty, but when a wheel archon detects a falsehood, their righteous wrath takes over and they mete out punishment to sinners without quarter.
Wheel Archon.saveDetails: statusowe +1 do wszystkich rzutów obronnych przeciw magii

The target must immediately attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save against the wheel archon's all-knowing eyes. If the creature is under any magical effect that disguises it or has altered its shape, the wheel archon attempts to counter that magical disguise effect (counteract [[/r 1d20+29]]{+29}, 8. level). After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the wheel archon's next turn.

spell->Misdirection (At Will; Self Only).name: Misdirection (At Will; Self Only)
spell->Misdirection (At Will; Self Only).description: You reshape the magic aura of one creature or object to resemble that of another. You designate one target as the primary target and the other as the secondary target. Effects that would detect auras on the primary target instead detect the same types of auras from the secondary target. A creature reading the aura can attempt to disbelieve the illusion. You can Dismiss the spell from up to a mile away.

condition->Drained.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]

When a creature successfully drains you of blood or life force, you become less healthy. Drained always includes a value. You take a status penalty equal to your drained value on Constitution-based checks, such as Fortitude saves. You also lose a number of Hit Points equal to your level (minimum 1) times the drained value, and your maximum Hit Points are reduced by the same amount. For example, if you're hit by an effect that inflicts drained 3 and you're a 3. poziomu character, you lose 9 Hit Points and reduce your maximum Hit Points by 9. Losing these Hit Points doesn't count as taking damage.

Each time you get a full night's rest, your drained value decreases by 1. This increases your maximum Hit Points, but you don't immediately recover the lost Hit Points.

action->Hatred of Red.name: Hatred of Red
action->Hatred of Red.description: Pairakas hate the color red. They won't wear the color or willingly enter any place painted red. Given a choice, they'll attack a creature wearing red first. If barred from expressing their displeasure toward the color by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.

equipment->Cloak of the Bat.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dipcMOtBFxtmsjkS]

Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

Aktywacja 2 komenda, Interakcja

Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Efekt You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4. kręgu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Postać Szkodnika} spell on you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.ioGzmVSmMGXWWBYb]{Efekt: Cloak of the Bat}

0.label: Cloak of the Bat, Maneuver in Flight

action->Consume Flesh.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ixPqVlqLaYTB1b23]

Wymagania The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Efekt The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[7d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

She also absorbs a portion of the memories once possessed by the creature she fed upon, potentially revealing secrets held by the flesh at the GM's discretion, and also gains a +1 status bonus to all skill checks for 1 minute.

action->Bolster Dead.name: Bolster Dead
action->Bolster Dead.description:
Częstotliwość once per turn

Wymagania Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Efekt You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the rank of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Opróżnienie Przedmiotu Więzi
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Wymagania The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Efekt The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

armor->Chain Shirt.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MPcM4Wt6KmWE2kGL]

Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

action->Warded Ground.name: Warded Ground
action->Warded Ground.description: The guard designates a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius} area within 30 feet as a protected zone. The guard's Strikes against targets in the protected zone deal an additional 2k6 precision damage.
